sinaiticus.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

verses.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.

sinaiticus.text: He was in the beginning with God.

verses.text: He was in the beginning with God.

sinaiticus.text: All things came into being through him, and without him came into being not one thing that is in being.

verses.text: All things came into being through him, and without him came into being not one thing that is in being.

sinaiticus.text: In him is life, and the life was the light of men.

verses.text: In him is life, and the life was the light of men.

sinaiticus.text: And the light shines in darkness, and the darkness comprehended it not.

verses.text: And the light shines in darkness, and the darkness comprehended it not.

sinaiticus.text: There came a man, sent from God; his name was John:

verses.text: this man came for a testimony, that he might testify of the light, that all through him might believe.

sinaiticus.text: He was not the light, but came that he might testify of the light.

verses.text: He was not the light, but came that he might testify of the light.

sinaiticus.text: That was the true light, which, coming into the world, gives light to every man.

verses.text: That was the true light, which, coming into the world, gives light to every man.

sinaiticus.text: He was in the world, and the world came into being through him, and the world knew him not.

verses.text: He was in the world, and the world came into being through him, and the world knew him not.

sinaiticus.text: He came to his own country, and his own people received him not.

verses.text: He came to his own country, and his own people received him not.

sinaiticus.text: But as many as received him, to them gave he the right to become children of God, to those that believe on his name,

sinaiticus.text: who were born not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of a man, but of God.

sinaiticus.text: And the Word became flesh, and tabernacled among us, and we beheld his glory, the glory as of the Only Begotten of the Father, full of grace and truth.

sinaiticus.text: John testified of him and cried, saying: This was he of whom I said: He that comes after me has been advanced before me, because he was before me.

verses.text: John testified of him and cried, saying: This was he of whom I said: He that comes after me has been advanced before me, because he was before me.

sinaiticus.text: For of his fullness have we all received, and grace for grace;

verses.text: for the law was given through Moses, the grace and the truth came through Jesus Christ.

sinaiticus.text: And the testimony of John is this, when the Jews of Jerusalem sent priests and Levites to ask him: Who art thou?

sinaiticus.text: And he confessed and denied not, and confessed: I am not the Christ.

verses.text: And he confessed and denied not, and confessed: I am not the Christ.

sinaiticus.text: And they asked him: What then? Art thou Elijah? He said: I am not. Art thou the prophet? and he answered: No.

sinaiticus.text: And I knew him not, but he that sent me to baptize in water, he said to me: On whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending and abiding on him, this is he that baptizeth in the Holy Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: It was Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, one of the two that had heard from John and followed him:

verses.text: It was Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, one of the two that had heard from John and followed him:

verses.text: he first finds his own brother Simon and says to him: We have found the Messiah, which is, translated, Christ.

sinaiticus.text: Philip finds Nathaniel, and says to him: We have found him of whom wrote Moses in the law, and the prophets, Jesus, who is of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.

sinaiticus.text: Nathaniel said to him: Whence knowest thou me? Jesus answered and said to him: Before Philip called thee, whilst thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.

sinaiticus.text: but whoever shall drink of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst, but the water that I shall give him shall become in him a fountain of water springing up to life eternal.170

verses.text: but whoever shall drink of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst, but the water that I shall give him shall become in him a fountain of water springing up to life eternal.170

sinaiticus.text: The woman says to him: Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.

verses.text: The woman says to him: Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.

sinaiticus.text: He says to her: Go, call thy husband and come hither.

verses.text: He says to her: Go, call thy husband and come hither.

sinaiticus.text: The woman answered and said: I have no husband, Jesus says to her: Well hast thou said: I have no husband;

verses.text: The woman answered and said: I have no husband, Jesus says to her: Well hast thou said: I have no husband;

sinaiticus.text: for thou hast had five husbands, and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband. This thou hast spoken truly.

verses.text: for thou hast had five husbands, and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband. This thou hast spoken truly.

sinaiticus.text: The woman says to him: Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.

verses.text: The woman says to him: Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.

sinaiticus.text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and you say that in Jerusalem is the place where we ought to worship.

verses.text: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and you say that in Jerusalem is the place where we ought to worship.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to her: Believe me, woman, that the hour comes when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, shall you worship the Father.

verses.text: Jesus says to her: Believe me, woman, that the hour comes when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, shall you worship the Father.

sinaiticus.text: You worship you know not what; we worship what we know, for salvation is of the Jews;

verses.text: You worship you know not what; we worship what we know, for salvation is of the Jews;

sinaiticus.text: but the hour comes and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth; for the Father seeks such to worship him.

verses.text: but the hour comes and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and in truth; for the Father seeks such to worship him.

sinaiticus.text: God is spirit; and they that worship must worship in spirit and truth.

verses.text: God is spirit; and they that worship must worship in spirit and truth.

sinaiticus.text: The woman says to him: I know that Messiah comes, who is called Christ: when he has come, he will tell us all things.

verses.text: The woman says to him: I know that Messiah comes, who is called Christ: when he has come, he will tell us all things.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to her: I that speak to thee am he.

verses.text: Jesus says to her: I that speak to thee am he.

sinaiticus.text: And on this came his disciples, and wondered that he talked with the woman: no one, however, said: What seekest thou or why talkest thou with her?

verses.text: And on this came his disciples, and wondered that he talked with the woman: no one, however, said: What seekest thou or why talkest thou with her?

sinaiticus.text: The woman therefore left her water-pot and went away into the city, and said to the men:

verses.text: The woman therefore left her water-pot and went away into the city, and said to the men:

sinaiticus.text: Come, see a man that has told me all things that I have done; is this the Christ?

verses.text: Come, see a man that has told me all things that I have done; is this the Christ?

sinaiticus.text: They went forth from the city and came to him.

verses.text: They went forth from the city and came to him.

sinaiticus.text: In n the meantime his disciples besought him, saying: Rabbi, eat.

verses.text: In n the meantime his disciples besought him, saying: Rabbi, eat.

sinaiticus.text: But he said to them: I have food to eat that you know not of.

verses.text: But he said to them: I have food to eat that you know not of.

sinaiticus.text: Then said the disciples one to another: Has any one brought him food?

verses.text: Then said the disciples one to another: Has any one brought him food?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to them: My food is to do the will of him that sent me, and finish his work.

verses.text: Jesus says to them: My food is to do the will of him that sent me, and finish his work.

sinaiticus.text: Say you a not that there are yet four months, and harvest comes? Behold, I say to you, lift up your eyes and behold the fields, that they are white for the harvest.

verses.text: Say you a not that there are yet four months, and harvest comes? Behold, I say to you, lift up your eyes and behold the fields, that they are white for the harvest.

sinaiticus.text: Already he that reaps receives reward and gathers fruit for eternal

verses.text: Already he that reaps receives reward and gathers fruit for eternal

sinaiticus.text: For in this is the saying true, that there is one that sows and another that reaps.

verses.text: For in this is the saying true, that there is one that sows and another that reaps.

sinaiticus.text: I have sent you to reap that on which you have not labored: others have labored, and you have entered into their labor.

verses.text: I have sent you to reap that on which you have not labored: others have labored, and you have entered into their labor.

sinaiticus.text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him because of the word of the woman who testified that he told me all things that I had done.

verses.text: And many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him because of the word of the woman who testified that he told me all things that I had done.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore the Samaritans came to him, they besought him to abide with them; and he abode; there two days.

verses.text: When therefore the Samaritans came to him, they besought him to abide with them; and he abode; there two days.

sinaiticus.text: And many more believed because of his word,

verses.text: And many more believed because of his word,

sinaiticus.text: and said to the woman: We no longer believe because of thy saying; for we ourselves have heard, and know that this is in truth the Saviour of the world.

verses.text: and said to the woman: We no longer believe because of thy saying; for we ourselves have heard, and know that this is in truth the Saviour of the world.

sinaiticus.text: But after the two days he went forth thence into Galilee.

verses.text: But after the two days he went forth thence into Galilee.

sinaiticus.text: For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.

verses.text: For Jesus himself testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore he came into Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all things that he did in Jerusalem at the feast; for they also had come to the feast.

verses.text: When therefore he came into Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all things that he did in Jerusalem at the feast; for they also had come to the feast.

sinaiticus.text: He came then again into Cana of Galilee, where he had made the water wine. And there was in Capernaum a nobleman, whose son was sick;

verses.text: He came then again into Cana of Galilee, where he had made the water wine. And there was in Capernaum a nobleman, whose son was sick;

sinaiticus.text: he, hearing that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, came to him, and besought him that he would come down and restore his son to health; for he was about to die.

verses.text: he, hearing that Jesus had come out of Judea into Galilee, came to him, and besought him that he would come down and restore his son to health; for he was about to die.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore said to him: Unless you see signs and wonders, you will not believe.

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to him: Unless you see signs and wonders, you will not believe.

sinaiticus.text: The nobleman said to him: Sir, come down before my child die.

verses.text: The nobleman said to him: Sir, come down before my child die.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus said to him: Go, thy son lives. The man believed the word that Jesus had spoken to him, and went.

verses.text: Jesus said to him: Go, thy son lives. The man believed the word that Jesus had spoken to him, and went.

sinaiticus.text: And as he was now going down, his servants met him and told him: Thy son lives.

verses.text: And as he was now going down, his servants met him and told him: Thy son lives.

sinaiticus.text: He then inquired of them the hour in which he began to mend: they then said to him: Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.

verses.text: He then inquired of them the hour in which he began to mend: they then said to him: Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.

sinaiticus.text: The father therefore knew that it was in that hour in which Jesus had said to him: Thy son lives; and he himself believed and all his house.

verses.text: The father therefore knew that it was in that hour in which Jesus had said to him: Thy son lives; and he himself believed and all his house.

sinaiticus.text: This again is the second sign that Jesus did on coming out of Judea into Galilee.

verses.text: This again is the second sign that Jesus did on coming out of Judea into Galilee.

sinaiticus.text: After this was the feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.172

verses.text: After this was the feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.172

sinaiticus.text: And there is in Jerusalem at the sheep gate a pool, which is called in Hebrew, Bethesda, having five porches.

verses.text: And there is in Jerusalem at the sheep gate a pool, which is called in Hebrew, Bethesda, having five porches.

sinaiticus.text: In these lay a multitude of sick persons, blind, lame, withered.

verses.text: In these lay a multitude of sick persons, blind, lame, withered.

sinaiticus.text: But there was a man there that had been sick thirty-eight years.

verses.text: But there was a man there that had been sick thirty-eight years.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus saw him lying, and, knowing that he had already been sick a long time, said to him: Wilt thou be restored to health?

verses.text: Jesus saw him lying, and, knowing that he had already been sick a long time, said to him: Wilt thou be restored to health?

sinaiticus.text: The sick man answered him: Sir, I have no man, that when the water is stirred he may put me into the pool; but while I am coming another goes down before me.

verses.text: The sick man answered him: Sir, I have no man, that when the water is stirred he may put me into the pool; but while I am coming another goes down before me.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to him: Arise, take up thy bed, and walk.

verses.text: Jesus says to him: Arise, take up thy bed, and walk.

sinaiticus.text: And the man was restored to health, and took up his bed and walked; but a sabbath was on that day.

verses.text: And the man was restored to health, and took up his bed and walked; but a sabbath was on that day.

sinaiticus.text: The Jews then said to him that had been cured: It is a sabbath, and it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed.

verses.text: The Jews then said to him that had been cured: It is a sabbath, and it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed.

sinaiticus.text: He answered them: He that made me well said to me: Take up thy bed and walk.

verses.text: He answered them: He that made me well said to me: Take up thy bed and walk.

sinaiticus.text: They asked him: Who is the man that said to thee: Take up and walk?

verses.text: They asked him: Who is the man that said to thee: Take up and walk?

sinaiticus.text: But the sick man knew not who he was; for Jesus had withdrawn, as a multitude was in the place.

verses.text: But the sick man knew not who he was; for Jesus had withdrawn, as a multitude was in the place.

sinaiticus.text: After this Jesus finds him in the temple; and he said to him: Behold, thou hast been restored to health: sin no more, lest something worse befall thee.

verses.text: After this Jesus finds him in the temple; and he said to him: Behold, thou hast been restored to health: sin no more, lest something worse befall thee.

sinaiticus.text: The man went away and told the Jews that it was Jesus that had made him well.

verses.text: The man went away and told the Jews that it was Jesus that had made him well.

sinaiticus.text: And for this reason the Jews persecuted Jesus, because he did these things on the sabbath.

verses.text: And for this reason the Jews persecuted Jesus, because he did these things on the sabbath.

sinaiticus.text: But he answered them: My Father works till now, and I work.

verses.text: But he answered them: My Father works till now, and I work.

sinaiticus.text: For this reason did the Jews seek the more to kill him, because he not only broke the sabbath, but also called God his own Father, making himself equal to God.

verses.text: For this reason did the Jews seek the more to kill him, because he not only broke the sabbath, but also called God his own Father, making himself equal to God.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore answered and said to them: Verily, verily, I say to you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he sees the Father do; for whatever he does, these also the Son does in like manner,

verses.text: Jesus therefore answered and said to them: Verily, verily, I say to you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he sees the Father do; for whatever he does, these also the Son does in like manner,

sinaiticus.text: For the Father loves the Son and shows him all things that he himself does; and greater works than these will he show him, that you may wonder.

verses.text: For the Father loves the Son and shows him all things that he himself does; and greater works than these will he show him, that you may wonder.

sinaiticus.text: For as the Father raises the dead and makes them alive, so also the Son makes alive whom he will.

verses.text: For as the Father raises the dead and makes them alive, so also the Son makes alive whom he will.

sinaiticus.text: For neither does the Father judge any one, but has given all

verses.text: For neither does the Father judge any one, but has given all

sinaiticus.text: that all may honor the Son as they honor the Father. He that honors not the Son honors not the Father who sent him.

verses.text: that all may honor the Son as they honor the Father. He that honors not the Son honors not the Father who sent him.

sinaiticus.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, that he that hears my word and believes on him that sent me has life eternal, and comes not into condemnation, but has passed out of death into life.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, that he that hears my word and believes on him that sent me has life eternal, and comes not into condemnation, but has passed out of death into life.

sinaiticus.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, that the hour comes, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God, and they that hear shall live.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, that the hour comes, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God, and they that hear shall live.

sinaiticus.text: For as the Father has life in himself, so has he given to the Son also to have life in himself.

verses.text: For as the Father has life in himself, so has he given to the Son also to have life in himself.

sinaiticus.text: And he has given him authority to execute judgment, because he is the Son of man.

verses.text: And he has given him authority to execute judgment, because he is the Son of man.

sinaiticus.text: Wonder not at this, for the hour comes in which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,

verses.text: Wonder not at this, for the hour comes in which all that are in the graves shall hear his voice,

sinaiticus.text: and shall come forth, those that have done good, to the resurrection of life; those that have done evil, to the resurrection of condemnation.

verses.text: and shall come forth, those that have done good, to the resurrection of life; those that have done evil, to the resurrection of condemnation.

sinaiticus.text: I can do nothing of myself: as I hear I judge, and my judgment is righteous, because I seek not my will, but the will of him that sent me.

verses.text: I can do nothing of myself: as I hear I judge, and my judgment is righteous, because I seek not my will, but the will of him that sent me.

sinaiticus.text: If I testify of myself, my testimony is not true:

verses.text: If I testify of myself, my testimony is not true:

sinaiticus.text: there is another that testifies of me, and you know that the testimony which he testifies of me is true.

verses.text: there is another that testifies of me, and you know that the testimony which he testifies of me is true.

sinaiticus.text: You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth;

verses.text: You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth;

sinaiticus.text: but I receive not testimony from man, but these things I say that you may be saved.

verses.text: but I receive not testimony from man, but these things I say that you may be saved.

sinaiticus.text: He was the burning and the shining light, and you were willing to rejoice for an hour in his light.

verses.text: He was the burning and the shining light, and you were willing to rejoice for an hour in his light.

sinaiticus.text: But I have testimony greater than that of John; for the works which the Father has given me to accomplish, the works themselves that I do, testify of me that the Father has sent me.

verses.text: But I have testimony greater than that of John; for the works which the Father has given me to accomplish, the works themselves that I do, testify of me that the Father has sent me.

sinaiticus.text: And the Father who sent me, he has testified of me: neither his voice have you heard at any time, nor his shape have you seen,

verses.text: And the Father who sent me, he has testified of me: neither his voice have you heard at any time, nor his shape have you seen,

sinaiticus.text: and his word you have not abiding in you, for whom he has sent, him you believe not.

verses.text: and his word you have not abiding in you, for whom he has sent, him you believe not.

sinaiticus.text: You search the scriptures, because you think that in them you have eternal life, and they are they that testify of me;

verses.text: You search the scriptures, because you think that in them you have eternal life, and they are they that testify of me;

sinaiticus.text: and yet you will not come to me that you may have life.

verses.text: and yet you will not come to me that you may have life.

sinaiticus.text: I receive not glory from men,

verses.text: I receive not glory from men,

sinaiticus.text: but I know you, that you have not the love of God in you.

verses.text: but I know you, that you have not the love of God in you.

sinaiticus.text: I have come in my Father’s name, and you receive me not: if another should come in his own name, him you would receive.174

verses.text: I have come in my Father’s name, and you receive me not: if another should come in his own name, him you would receive.174

sinaiticus.text: How can you believe while receiving glory one from another, and you seek not the glory that is from the only God?

verses.text: How can you believe while receiving glory one from another, and you seek not the glory that is from the only God?

sinaiticus.text: Think not that I will accuse you to the Father: there is he that accuses you, Moses, in whom you trust.

verses.text: Think not that I will accuse you to the Father: there is he that accuses you, Moses, in whom you trust.

sinaiticus.text: For if you had believed Moses, you would have believed me; for he wrote of me.

verses.text: For if you had believed Moses, you would have believed me; for he wrote of me.

sinaiticus.text: But if you believe not his writings, how will you believe my words?

verses.text: But if you believe not his writings, how will you believe my words?

sinaiticus.text: After this Jesus went away beyond the sea of Galilee, which is the sea of Tiberias;

verses.text: After this Jesus went away beyond the sea of Galilee, which is the sea of Tiberias;

sinaiticus.text: and a great multitude followed him because they saw the signs that he did in case of the sick.

verses.text: and a great multitude followed him because they saw the signs that he did in case of the sick.

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus went up into the mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.

verses.text: But Jesus went up into the mountain, and there he sat with his disciples.

sinaiticus.text: And the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was near.

verses.text: And the Passover, the feast of the Jews, was near.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus then, lifting up his eyes and seeing that a great multitude was coming to him, said to Philip: Whence can we buy bread, that these may eat?

verses.text: Jesus then, lifting up his eyes and seeing that a great multitude was coming to him, said to Philip: Whence can we buy bread, that these may eat?

sinaiticus.text: But this he said to try him; for he himself knew what he was about to do.

verses.text: But this he said to try him; for he himself knew what he was about to do.

sinaiticus.text: Philip answered him: Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not enough for these, that each one may take some little.

verses.text: Philip answered him: Two hundred denarii worth of bread is not enough for these, that each one may take some little.

sinaiticus.text: One of his disciples, Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, says to him:

verses.text: One of his disciples, Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, says to him:

sinaiticus.text: There is a lad here who has five barley loaves and two little fishes; but what are these among so many?

verses.text: There is a lad here who has five barley loaves and two little fishes; but what are these among so many?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus said: Make the men recline. And there was much grass in the place. The men therefore reclined, in number about five thousand.

verses.text: Jesus said: Make the men recline. And there was much grass in the place. The men therefore reclined, in number about five thousand.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore took the loaves, and gave thanks, and gave to those that reclined; in like manner also of the fishes as much as they wished.

verses.text: Jesus therefore took the loaves, and gave thanks, and gave to those that reclined; in like manner also of the fishes as much as they wished.

sinaiticus.text: But when they were filled, he said to his disciples: Gather up the broken pieces that remain, that nothing be lost.

verses.text: But when they were filled, he said to his disciples: Gather up the broken pieces that remain, that nothing be lost.

sinaiticus.text: They gathered them therefore, and filled twelve traveling-baskets with broken pieces from the five barley loaves, which remained after they had eaten.

verses.text: They gathered them therefore, and filled twelve traveling-baskets with broken pieces from the five barley loaves, which remained after they had eaten.

sinaiticus.text: The men therefore, seeing the sign that he had done, said: This is in truth the prophet that comes into the world.

verses.text: The men therefore, seeing the sign that he had done, said: This is in truth the prophet that comes into the world.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus then, knowing that they were about to come and seize him to make him king, fled again into the mountain himself alone.

verses.text: Jesus then, knowing that they were about to come and seize him to make him king, fled again into the mountain himself alone.

sinaiticus.text: and having entered a ship, were going beyond the sea to Capernaum. But darkness overtook them, and Jesus had not yet come to them:

verses.text: and having entered a ship, were going beyond the sea to Capernaum. But darkness overtook them, and Jesus had not yet come to them:

sinaiticus.text: the sea also arose, because a great wind was blowing.

verses.text: the sea also arose, because a great wind was blowing.

sinaiticus.text: Having rowed therefore about twenty-five or thirty furlongs, they see Jesus walking on the sea, and coming near the ship, and they were afraid.

verses.text: Having rowed therefore about twenty-five or thirty furlongs, they see Jesus walking on the sea, and coming near the ship, and they were afraid.

sinaiticus.text: But he said to them: It is I, be not afraid.

verses.text: But he said to them: It is I, be not afraid.

sinaiticus.text: They then willingly received him into the ship, and immediately the ship was at the land to which they were going.

verses.text: They then willingly received him into the ship, and immediately the ship was at the land to which they were going.

sinaiticus.text: On the morrow the multitude that stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other little ship there but one, and that Jesus had not entered the ship with his disciples, but his disciples had gone away alone:

verses.text: On the morrow the multitude that stood on the other side of the sea saw that there was no other little ship there but one, and that Jesus had not entered the ship with his disciples, but his disciples had gone away alone:

sinaiticus.text: however, little ships had come from Tiberias, near the place where they ate bread when the Lord had given thanks.

verses.text: however, little ships had come from Tiberias, near the place where they ate bread when the Lord had given thanks.

sinaiticus.text: When, therefore, the multitude saw that Jesus was not there, nor his disciples, they entered the little ships and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.

verses.text: When, therefore, the multitude saw that Jesus was not there, nor his disciples, they entered the little ships and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: And having found him on the other side of the sea, they said to him: Rabbi, when earnest thou hither?

verses.text: And having found him on the other side of the sea, they said to him: Rabbi, when earnest thou hither?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered them and said: Verily, verily, I say to you, you seek me not because you saw the signs, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled.

verses.text: Jesus answered them and said: Verily, verily, I say to you, you seek me not because you saw the signs, but because you ate of the loaves and were filled.

sinaiticus.text: Labor not for the food that perishes, but for the food that abides to life eternal, which the Son of man gives you; for him has God the Father attested.

verses.text: Labor not for the food that perishes, but for the food that abides to life eternal, which the Son of man gives you; for him has God the Father attested.

sinaiticus.text: They said therefore to him: What must we do that we may work the works of God?

verses.text: They said therefore to him: What must we do that we may work the works of God?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered and said to them: This is the work of God, that you believe on him whom he has sent.

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them: This is the work of God, that you believe on him whom he has sent.

sinaiticus.text: They said then to him: What doest thou then as a sign, that we may see and believe thee; what workest thou?

verses.text: They said then to him: What doest thou then as a sign, that we may see and believe thee; what workest thou?

sinaiticus.text: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, as it is written: Bread from heaven gave he them to eat.

verses.text: Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, as it is written: Bread from heaven gave he them to eat.

sinaiticus.text: Then said Jesus to them: Verily, verily, I say to you, Moses has not given you the bread from heaven; but my Father gives you the bread from heaven, the true.

verses.text: Then said Jesus to them: Verily, verily, I say to you, Moses has not given you the bread from heaven; but my Father gives you the bread from heaven, the true.

sinaiticus.text: For the bread which is God’s is he that comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.

verses.text: For the bread which is God’s is he that comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.

sinaiticus.text: They said therefore to him: Lord, always give us this bread.

verses.text: They said therefore to him: Lord, always give us this bread.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus then said to them: I am the bread of life: he that comes to me shall not hunger, and he that believes on me shall never thirst.

verses.text: Jesus then said to them: I am the bread of life: he that comes to me shall not hunger, and he that believes on me shall never thirst.

sinaiticus.text: But I said to you that you have seen and do not believe.176

verses.text: But I said to you that you have seen and do not believe.176

sinaiticus.text: All that the Father gives me shall come to me, and him that comes to me I will not cast out;

verses.text: All that the Father gives me shall come to me, and him that comes to me I will not cast out;

sinaiticus.text: for I have come down from heaven, not that I might do my will, but the will of him that sent me.

verses.text: for I have come down from heaven, not that I might do my will, but the will of him that sent me.

sinaiticus.text: And this is the will of him that sent me, that I shall lose nothing of all that he has given me, but shall raise it up in the last day.

verses.text: And this is the will of him that sent me, that I shall lose nothing of all that he has given me, but shall raise it up in the last day.

sinaiticus.text: For this is the will of my Father, that whoever sees the Son and believes on him may have life eternal, and I shall raise him up in the last day.

verses.text: For this is the will of my Father, that whoever sees the Son and believes on him may have life eternal, and I shall raise him up in the last day.

sinaiticus.text: The Jews therefore murmured concerning him, because he said: I am the bread that came down from heaven;

verses.text: The Jews therefore murmured concerning him, because he said: I am the bread that came down from heaven;

sinaiticus.text: and they said: Is not this Jesus the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How now says this man: I have come down from heaven?

verses.text: and they said: Is not this Jesus the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How now says this man: I have come down from heaven?

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them: Murmur not among yourselves.

verses.text: No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draw him, and I will raise him up in the last day.

verses.text: It is written in the prophets: And they shall all be taught of God: every one that has heard from the Father and has learned, comes to me.

verses.text: Not that any one has seen the Father, but he that is from God, he has seen the Father.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, he that believes has life eternal.

verses.text: I am the bread of life.

verses.text: Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness and died:

verses.text: this is the bread that comes down from heaven, that any one may eat of it and not die.

sinaiticus.text: I am the living bread, that came down from heaven: if any one eat of my bread, he shall live forever; and the bread also that I will give for the life of the world, is my flesh.

verses.text: The Jews then contended one with another, saying: How can this man give us his flesh to eat?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore said to them: Verily, verily, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of man and drink his blood, you have no life in you.

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to them: Verily, verily, I say to you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of man and drink his blood, you have no life in you.

verses.text: He that eats my flesh and drinks my blood has life eternal, and I will raise him up in the, last day.

sinaiticus.text: For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.

verses.text: For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.

sinaiticus.text: He that eats my flesh and drinks my blood abides in me and I in him.

verses.text: He that eats my flesh and drinks my blood abides in me and I in him.

verses.text: This is the bread that came down from heaven, not as the fathers ate and died: he that eats this bread shall live forever.

sinaiticus.text: These things spoke he in the synagogue as he taught in Capernaum.

verses.text: These things spoke he in the synagogue as he taught in Capernaum.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore many of his disciples on hearing it said: A hard saying is this: who can hear it?

verses.text: Therefore many of his disciples on hearing it said: A hard saying is this: who can hear it?

verses.text: The spirit is that which makes alive; the flesh profits nothing: the words that I have spoken to you are spirit, and are life.

verses.text: But there are some of you that believe not. For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were that believed not, and who it was that would deliver him up.

verses.text: After this Jesus walked in Galilee; for he would not walk in Judea, because the Jews sought to kill him.

verses.text: But the feast of the Jews, that of tabernacles, was near.

verses.text: His brothers therefore said to him: Depart hence and go into Judea, that thy disciples also may see the works that thou doest;

sinaiticus.text: for no one does any thing in secret and desires himself to be known openly. If thou doest these things, make thyself manifest to the world.

verses.text: for no one does any thing in secret and desires himself to be known openly. If thou doest these things, make thyself manifest to the world.

verses.text: For neither did his brothers believe on him.

verses.text: Jesus says to them: My time is not yet present, but your time is always ready.

verses.text: The world cannot hate you, but me it hates, because I testify of it that its works are evil.178

verses.text: Do you go up to the feast: I go not up to this feast, because my time has not yet fully come.

verses.text: Having said these things, he abode in Galilee.

verses.text: But when his brothers had gone up to the feast, then he himself also went up, not openly, but in secret.

sinaiticus.text: The Jews then sought for him at the feast, and said: Where is he?

verses.text: The Jews then sought for him at the feast, and said: Where is he?

sinaiticus.text: And there was much murmuring concerning him among the multitude; some said: He is a good man: others said: No, but he deceives the multitude.

verses.text: And there was much murmuring concerning him among the multitude; some said: He is a good man: others said: No, but he deceives the multitude.

sinaiticus.text: No one, however, spoke boldly concerning him, for fear of the Jews.

verses.text: No one, however, spoke boldly concerning him, for fear of the Jews.

verses.text: But now at the middle of the festival Jesus went up into the, temple and taught.

verses.text: The Jews therefore were astonished, saying: How knows this man letters, not having learned?

verses.text: Jesus then answered them and said: My teaching is not mine, but his that sent me:

sinaiticus.text: if any one will do his will he shall know of the teaching, whether it is of God, or I speak of myself.

verses.text: if any one will do his will he shall know of the teaching, whether it is of God, or I speak of myself.

sinaiticus.text: He that speaks of himself seeks his own glory: he that seeks the glory of him that sent him, he is true, and unrighteousness is not in him.

verses.text: He that speaks of himself seeks his own glory: he that seeks the glory of him that sent him, he is true, and unrighteousness is not in him.

verses.text: The multitude answered: Thou hast a demon: who seekest to kill thee?

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them: One work I have done and you all wonder.

verses.text: If a man receives circumcision on the sabbath, that the law of Moses may not be broken, are you angry with me because I restored the entire man to health on the sabbath?

verses.text: However, we know this man, whence he is; but when the Christ comes, no one knows whence he is.

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to them: Though I testify of myself, my testimony is true, for I know whence I came and whither I go: you know not whence I come or whither I go.

verses.text: The Jews then said: Will he kill himself, because he says: Whither I go you cannot come?

sinaiticus.text: While he was speaking these things many believed on him.

verses.text: While he was speaking these things many believed on him.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus then said to the Jews that believed on him: If you abide in my word, you are my disciples in truth,

verses.text: Jesus then said to the Jews that believed on him: If you abide in my word, you are my disciples in truth,

sinaiticus.text: and you shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

verses.text: and you shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

sinaiticus.text: They answered to him: We are Abraham’s posterity, and have never been in bondage to any one; how sayest thou: You shall become free?

verses.text: They answered to him: We are Abraham’s posterity, and have never been in bondage to any one; how sayest thou: You shall become free?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered them: Verily, verily, I say to you, that every one that does sin is a servant of sin.

verses.text: Jesus answered them: Verily, verily, I say to you, that every one that does sin is a servant of sin.

sinaiticus.text: But the servant abides not in the house forever: the Son abides forever.

verses.text: But the servant abides not in the house forever: the Son abides forever.

sinaiticus.text: If, then, the Son shall make you free, you shall be free indeed.

verses.text: If, then, the Son shall make you free, you shall be free indeed.

sinaiticus.text: I know that you are Abraham’s posterity; but you seek to kill me, because my word has no place in you.

verses.text: I know that you are Abraham’s posterity; but you seek to kill me, because my word has no place in you.

sinaiticus.text: I speak what things I have seen with my Father, and you then do what things you have heard from your father.

verses.text: I speak what things I have seen with my Father, and you then do what things you have heard from your father.

sinaiticus.text: They answered and said to him: Abraham is our father. Jesus says to them: If you were the children of Abraham, you would do the works of Abraham;

verses.text: They answered and said to him: Abraham is our father. Jesus says to them: If you were the children of Abraham, you would do the works of Abraham;

sinaiticus.text: but now you seek to kill me, a man that has spoken to you the truth, which I heard from God: this Abraham did not.

verses.text: but now you seek to kill me, a man that has spoken to you the truth, which I heard from God: this Abraham did not.

sinaiticus.text: You do the works of your fathers. They said to him: We have not been born of lewdness; we have one Father, God.

verses.text: You do the works of your fathers. They said to him: We have not been born of lewdness; we have one Father, God.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus said to them: If God were your Father, you would love me; for I came forth from God and have come hither: nor indeed have I come of myself, but he sent me.

verses.text: Jesus said to them: If God were your Father, you would love me; for I came forth from God and have come hither: nor indeed have I come of myself, but he sent me.

sinaiticus.text: Why know you not my speech? because you cannot hear my word.

verses.text: Why know you not my speech? because you cannot hear my word.

sinaiticus.text: You are of your father, the devil, and the desires of your father you will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and has not stood in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks what is

verses.text: You are of your father, the devil, and the desires of your father you will do. He was a murderer from the beginning, and has not stood in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks what is

sinaiticus.text: But because I tell you the truth, you believe me not.

verses.text: But because I tell you the truth, you believe me not.

sinaiticus.text: Which of you convinces me of sin? If I speak the truth, why do you not believe me?

verses.text: Which of you convinces me of sin? If I speak the truth, why do you not believe me?

sinaiticus.text: He that is of God hears the words of God; for this reason you hear not, because you are not of God.

verses.text: He that is of God hears the words of God; for this reason you hear not, because you are not of God.

sinaiticus.text: The Jews answered and said to him: Do we not well say that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a demon?

verses.text: The Jews answered and said to him: Do we not well say that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a demon?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered: I have not a demon, but I honor my Father, and you dishonor me.

verses.text: Jesus answered: I have not a demon, but I honor my Father, and you dishonor me.

sinaiticus.text: But I seek not my glory: there is that seeks and judges.

verses.text: But I seek not my glory: there is that seeks and judges.

sinaiticus.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, if any one keep my word, he shall never see death.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, if any one keep my word, he shall never see death.

sinaiticus.text: The Jews said to him: Now we know that thou hast a demon. Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest: If any one keep my word, he shall never taste of death:

verses.text: The Jews said to him: Now we know that thou hast a demon. Abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest: If any one keep my word, he shall never taste of death:

sinaiticus.text: art thou greater than our father Abraham, who is dead? And the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?

verses.text: art thou greater than our father Abraham, who is dead? And the prophets are dead: whom makest thou thyself?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered: If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing; it is my Father that glorifies me, of whom you say that he is your God;

verses.text: Jesus answered: If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing; it is my Father that glorifies me, of whom you say that he is your God;

sinaiticus.text: and yet you have not known him, but I know him. If I should say that I do not know him, I should be a liar like you; but I know him, and his word I keep.

verses.text: and yet you have not known him, but I know him. If I should say that I do not know him, I should be a liar like you; but I know him, and his word I keep.

sinaiticus.text: Abraham, your father, rejoiced that he could see my day, and he saw it and was glad.

verses.text: Abraham, your father, rejoiced that he could see my day, and he saw it and was glad.

sinaiticus.text: The Jews then said to him: Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?

verses.text: The Jews then said to him: Thou art not yet fifty years old, and hast thou seen Abraham?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus said to them: Verily, verily, I say to you, before Abraham came into being, I am.

verses.text: Jesus said to them: Verily, verily, I say to you, before Abraham came into being, I am.

sinaiticus.text: They therefore took up stones to throw at him; but Jesus hid himself and went out of the temple.

verses.text: They therefore took up stones to throw at him; but Jesus hid himself and went out of the temple.

sinaiticus.text: And passing by he saw a man blind from his birth.

verses.text: And passing by he saw a man blind from his birth.

sinaiticus.text: And his disciples asked him, saying: Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?

verses.text: And his disciples asked him, saying: Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered: Neither this man sinned nor his parents, but that the works of God might be manifested in him.

verses.text: Jesus answered: Neither this man sinned nor his parents, but that the works of God might be manifested in him.

sinaiticus.text: We must work the works of him that sent us while it is day: there comes night, when no man can work.

verses.text: We must work the works of him that sent us while it is day: there comes night, when no man can work.

sinaiticus.text: While I am in the world, I am the Light of the world.

verses.text: While I am in the world, I am the Light of the world.

sinaiticus.text: He said these things, and spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and anointed his eyes with the clay,184

verses.text: He said these things, and spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and anointed his eyes with the clay,184

sinaiticus.text: and said to him: Go wash in the pool of Siloam, which is, translated. Sent. He went therefore and washed, and came seeing.

verses.text: and said to him: Go wash in the pool of Siloam, which is, translated. Sent. He went therefore and washed, and came seeing.

sinaiticus.text: The neighbors therefore, and those that had seen him before, that he was a beggar, said: Is not this he that sat and begged?

verses.text: The neighbors therefore, and those that had seen him before, that he was a beggar, said: Is not this he that sat and begged?

sinaiticus.text: Others said that this is he; others said: No, but he is like him. He said: I am he.

verses.text: Others said that this is he; others said: No, but he is like him. He said: I am he.

sinaiticus.text: They therefore said to him: How were thy eyes opened?

verses.text: They therefore said to him: How were thy eyes opened?

sinaiticus.text: He answered: The man that is called Jesus made clay and anointed my eyes, and said to me: Go to Siloam and wash. Having gone therefore and washed, I received sight.

verses.text: He answered: The man that is called Jesus made clay and anointed my eyes, and said to me: Go to Siloam and wash. Having gone therefore and washed, I received sight.

sinaiticus.text: They said to him: Where is he? He says: I know not.

verses.text: They said to him: Where is he? He says: I know not.

sinaiticus.text: They bring to the Pharisees him that was formerly blind.

verses.text: They bring to the Pharisees him that was formerly blind.

sinaiticus.text: And it was a sabbath on the day in which Jesus made clay and opened his eyes.

verses.text: And it was a sabbath on the day in which Jesus made clay and opened his eyes.

sinaiticus.text: Again therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he had received sight. He said to them: He put clay upon my eyes and I washed and do see.

verses.text: Again therefore the Pharisees also asked him how he had received sight. He said to them: He put clay upon my eyes and I washed and do see.

sinaiticus.text: Some of the Pharisees therefore said: This man is not from God, for he keeps not the sabbath. Others said: How can a man a sinner do such signs? And there was a division among them.

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees therefore said: This man is not from God, for he keeps not the sabbath. Others said: How can a man a sinner do such signs? And there was a division among them.

sinaiticus.text: They say therefore to the blind man again: What sayest thou of him, because he has opened thy eyes? He said: He is a prophet.

verses.text: They say therefore to the blind man again: What sayest thou of him, because he has opened thy eyes? He said: He is a prophet.

sinaiticus.text: The Jews therefore did not believe concerning him, that he was blind and had received sight, till they had called the parents of him that had received sight,

verses.text: The Jews therefore did not believe concerning him, that he was blind and had received sight, till they had called the parents of him that had received sight,

sinaiticus.text: and asked them, saying: Is this your son, of whom you say that he was born blind? How, then, does he now see?

verses.text: and asked them, saying: Is this your son, of whom you say that he was born blind? How, then, does he now see?

sinaiticus.text: His parents therefore answered and said: We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;

verses.text: His parents therefore answered and said: We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind;

sinaiticus.text: but how he now sees we know not, or who opened his eyes we know not: ask him; he is of age: he shall speak for himself

verses.text: but how he now sees we know not, or who opened his eyes we know not: ask him; he is of age: he shall speak for himself

sinaiticus.text: These things said his parents because they feared the Jews; for the Jews had already agreed that if any one should confess him to be Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.

verses.text: These things said his parents because they feared the Jews; for the Jews had already agreed that if any one should confess him to be Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.

sinaiticus.text: For this reason his parents said that he is of age, ask him.

verses.text: For this reason his parents said that he is of age, ask him.

sinaiticus.text: They therefore a second time called the man that had been blind, and said to him: Give glory to God: we know that this man is a sinner.

verses.text: They therefore a second time called the man that had been blind, and said to him: Give glory to God: we know that this man is a sinner.

sinaiticus.text: He then answered: If he is a sinner, I know not: one thing I know, that, being blind, I now see.

verses.text: He then answered: If he is a sinner, I know not: one thing I know, that, being blind, I now see.

sinaiticus.text: They said therefore to him: What did he for thee? How opened he thy eyes?

verses.text: They said therefore to him: What did he for thee? How opened he thy eyes?

sinaiticus.text: He answered them: I have told you already, and you did not hear:

verses.text: He answered them: I have told you already, and you did not hear:

sinaiticus.text: They reviled him and said: Thou art a disciple of that man, but we are Moses’ disciples:

verses.text: They reviled him and said: Thou art a disciple of that man, but we are Moses’ disciples:

sinaiticus.text: we know that God spoke to Moses, but this man, we know not whence he is.

verses.text: we know that God spoke to Moses, but this man, we know not whence he is.

sinaiticus.text: The man answered and said to them: Why, in this is that which is wonderful, that you know not whence he is, and yet he has opened my eyes.

verses.text: The man answered and said to them: Why, in this is that which is wonderful, that you know not whence he is, and yet he has opened my eyes.

sinaiticus.text: We know that God hears not sinners, but if any one be a worshiper of God and do his will, him he hears.

verses.text: We know that God hears not sinners, but if any one be a worshiper of God and do his will, him he hears.

sinaiticus.text: Never was it heard that any one opened the eyes of one that had been born blind:

verses.text: Never was it heard that any one opened the eyes of one that had been born blind:

sinaiticus.text: if this man were not of God, he could do nothing.

verses.text: if this man were not of God, he could do nothing.

sinaiticus.text: They answered and said to him: Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.

verses.text: They answered and said to him: Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out, and he found him and said: Dost thou believe on the Son of man?

verses.text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out, and he found him and said: Dost thou believe on the Son of man?

sinaiticus.text: He answered and said: And who is he, Lord, that I may believe on him?

verses.text: He answered and said: And who is he, Lord, that I may believe on him?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus said to him: Thou hast both seen him, and he it is that talks with thee.

verses.text: Jesus said to him: Thou hast both seen him, and he it is that talks with thee.

sinaiticus.text: He said, Lord, I believe; and he worshiped him.

verses.text: He said, Lord, I believe; and he worshiped him.

sinaiticus.text: And Jesus said: For judgment have I come into this world, that those that see not may see, and that those that see may become blind.

verses.text: And Jesus said: For judgment have I come into this world, that those that see not may see, and that those that see may become blind.

sinaiticus.text: Some of the Pharisees that were with him heard, and said to him: Are we also blind?

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees that were with him heard, and said to him: Are we also blind?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus said to them: If you were blind, you would not have sin; but now you say: We see: your sin remains.

verses.text: Jesus said to them: If you were blind, you would not have sin; but now you say: We see: your sin remains.

sinaiticus.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, he that enters not through the door into the sheepfold, but goes up by some other way, he is a thief and a robber:

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, he that enters not through the door into the sheepfold, but goes up by some other way, he is a thief and a robber:

sinaiticus.text: but he that enters through the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

verses.text: but he that enters through the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

sinaiticus.text: To him the porter opens, and the sheep hear his voice, and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.

verses.text: To him the porter opens, and the sheep hear his voice, and he calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.

sinaiticus.text: When he puts forth all of his own sheep, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him, because they know his voice;

verses.text: When he puts forth all of his own sheep, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him, because they know his voice;

sinaiticus.text: but a stranger they will not follow, but flee from him, because they know not the voice of strangers.

verses.text: but a stranger they will not follow, but flee from him, because they know not the voice of strangers.

sinaiticus.text: This parable spoke Jesus to them; but they knew not what things they were that he spoke to them.

verses.text: This parable spoke Jesus to them; but they knew not what things they were that he spoke to them.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore said: Verily, verily, I say to you: I am the door of the sheep.186

verses.text: Jesus therefore said: Verily, verily, I say to you: I am the door of the sheep.186

sinaiticus.text: All as many as have come are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not hear them.

verses.text: All as many as have come are thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not hear them.

sinaiticus.text: I am the door: through me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.

verses.text: I am the door: through me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.

sinaiticus.text: The thief comes not but that he may steal and kill and destroy: I have come that they may have life, and have it abundantly.

verses.text: The thief comes not but that he may steal and kill and destroy: I have come that they may have life, and have it abundantly.

sinaiticus.text: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep:

verses.text: I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep:

sinaiticus.text: he that is a hireling and not a shepherd, to whom the sheep do not belong, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees, and the wolf seizes and scatters them,

verses.text: he that is a hireling and not a shepherd, to whom the sheep do not belong, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and flees, and the wolf seizes and scatters them,

sinaiticus.text: because he is a hireling, and cares not for the sheep.

verses.text: because he is a hireling, and cares not for the sheep.

sinaiticus.text: I am the good shepherd, and know mine, and mine know me,

verses.text: I am the good shepherd, and know mine, and mine know me,

sinaiticus.text: as the Father knows me and I know the Father; and I lay down my life for the sheep.

verses.text: as the Father knows me and I know the Father; and I lay down my life for the sheep.

sinaiticus.text: And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also must I bring, and they shall hear my voice, and there shall be one fold, one shepherd.

verses.text: And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also must I bring, and they shall hear my voice, and there shall be one fold, one shepherd.

sinaiticus.text: For this reason my Father loves me, because I lay down my life, that I may take it again.

verses.text: For this reason my Father loves me, because I lay down my life, that I may take it again.

sinaiticus.text: No one takes it from me, but I lay it down of myself. Authority have I to lay it down, and authority have I to take it again: this commandment I received from my Father.

verses.text: No one takes it from me, but I lay it down of myself. Authority have I to lay it down, and authority have I to take it again: this commandment I received from my Father.

sinaiticus.text: There arose again a division among the Jews because of these words.

verses.text: There arose again a division among the Jews because of these words.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore many of them said: He has a demon and is mad; why hear him?

verses.text: Therefore many of them said: He has a demon and is mad; why hear him?

sinaiticus.text: Others said: These words are not of one that has a demon: can a demon open the eyes of the blind?

verses.text: Others said: These words are not of one that has a demon: can a demon open the eyes of the blind?

sinaiticus.text: But the feast of dedication was held in Jerusalem; it was winter;

verses.text: But the feast of dedication was held in Jerusalem; it was winter;

sinaiticus.text: and Jesus was walking in the temple, in Solomon’s porch.

verses.text: and Jesus was walking in the temple, in Solomon’s porch.

sinaiticus.text: The Jews therefore came around him and said to him: How long dost thou keep us in suspense? If thou art the Christ, tell us plainly.

verses.text: The Jews therefore came around him and said to him: How long dost thou keep us in suspense? If thou art the Christ, tell us plainly.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered: I have told you, and you do not believe: the works

verses.text: Jesus answered: I have told you, and you do not believe: the works

sinaiticus.text: that I do in my Father’s name, these testify of me;

verses.text: that I do in my Father’s name, these testify of me;

sinaiticus.text: but you believe not, because you are not of my sheep.

verses.text: but you believe not, because you are not of my sheep.

sinaiticus.text: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me,

verses.text: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me,

sinaiticus.text: and I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish, and no one shall snatch them out of my hand.

verses.text: and I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish, and no one shall snatch them out of my hand.

sinaiticus.text: What the Father has given to me is greater than all, and no one can snatch them out of the Father’s hand.

verses.text: What the Father has given to me is greater than all, and no one can snatch them out of the Father’s hand.

sinaiticus.text: I and the Father are one.

verses.text: I and the Father are one.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered them: Many good works have I shown you from the Father; for what one of these do you stone me?

verses.text: Jesus answered them: Many good works have I shown you from the Father; for what one of these do you stone me?

sinaiticus.text: The Jews answered him: For a good work we stone thee not, but for blasphemy, and because thou, being man, makest thyself God.

verses.text: The Jews answered him: For a good work we stone thee not, but for blasphemy, and because thou, being man, makest thyself God.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered them: Is it not written in your law, I said: You are gods?

verses.text: Jesus answered them: Is it not written in your law, I said: You are gods?

sinaiticus.text: If he called them gods, to whom the word of God came, and the Scripture cannot be broken:

verses.text: If he called them gods, to whom the word of God came, and the Scripture cannot be broken:

sinaiticus.text: of him whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, say you: Thou blasphemest; because I said: I am the Son of God?

verses.text: of him whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, say you: Thou blasphemest; because I said: I am the Son of God?

sinaiticus.text: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not;

verses.text: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not;

sinaiticus.text: but if I do, although you believe not me, believe the works, that you may know and acknowledge that the Father is in me and I in the Father.

verses.text: but if I do, although you believe not me, believe the works, that you may know and acknowledge that the Father is in me and I in the Father.

sinaiticus.text: They then sought to take him, and he went forth from their hand.

verses.text: They then sought to take him, and he went forth from their hand.

sinaiticus.text: And he went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John was first baptizing, and abode there.

verses.text: And he went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John was first baptizing, and abode there.

sinaiticus.text: And many came to him and said: John indeed did no sign, but all things whatever John said of this man were true.

verses.text: And many came to him and said: John indeed did no sign, but all things whatever John said of this man were true.

sinaiticus.text: And many believed on him there.

verses.text: And many believed on him there.

sinaiticus.text: And it was Mary that anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.

verses.text: And it was Mary that anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.

sinaiticus.text: The sisters therefore sent to him, saying: Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.

verses.text: The sisters therefore sent to him, saying: Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus hearing it, said: This sickness is not to death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified through it.

verses.text: But Jesus hearing it, said: This sickness is not to death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified through it.

sinaiticus.text: Now, Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.

verses.text: Now, Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore he had heard that he was sick, then indeed he abode two days in the place where he was:

verses.text: When therefore he had heard that he was sick, then indeed he abode two days in the place where he was:

sinaiticus.text: then after this he says to the disciples: Let us go into Judea again.

verses.text: then after this he says to the disciples: Let us go into Judea again.

sinaiticus.text: The disciples say to him: Rabbi, the Jews just now sought to stone thee, and goest thou thither again?

verses.text: The disciples say to him: Rabbi, the Jews just now sought to stone thee, and goest thou thither again?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered: Are there not twelve hours of the day? If any one walk in the day, he stumbles not, because he sees the light of the world:

verses.text: Jesus answered: Are there not twelve hours of the day? If any one walk in the day, he stumbles not, because he sees the light of the world:

sinaiticus.text: if any one walk in the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him.

verses.text: if any one walk in the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him.

sinaiticus.text: These things said he, and after this he says to them: Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep; but I go that I may awake him.188

verses.text: These things said he, and after this he says to them: Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep; but I go that I may awake him.188

sinaiticus.text: Then the disciples said to him: Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he shall be saved.

verses.text: Then the disciples said to him: Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he shall be saved.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus, however, had spoken of his death; but they supposed that he spoke of the rest of sleep.

verses.text: Jesus, however, had spoken of his death; but they supposed that he spoke of the rest of sleep.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore Jesus then said to them plainly: Lazarus is dead;

verses.text: Therefore Jesus then said to them plainly: Lazarus is dead;

sinaiticus.text: and I rejoice for your sakes, in order that you may believe, that I was not there; but let us go to him.

verses.text: Thomas, who is called Didymus, then said to his fellow-disciples: Let I us also go, that we may die with him.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus came therefore and found that he had been four days in the tomb.

sinaiticus.text: But Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen furlongs off.

sinaiticus.text: Martha therefore, when she heard that Jesus was coming, met him; but Mary sat in the house.

verses.text: Martha therefore, when she heard that Jesus was coming, met him; but Mary sat in the house.

sinaiticus.text: Martha therefore said to Jesus: Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother would not have died.

verses.text: Martha therefore said to Jesus: Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother would not have died.

sinaiticus.text: And now I know that whatever things thou shalt ask of God, God will give thee.

verses.text: And now I know that whatever things thou shalt ask of God, God will give thee.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to her: Thy brother shall rise.

verses.text: Jesus says to her: Thy brother shall rise.

verses.text: Martha says to him: I know that he will rise in the resurrection, in the last day.

sinaiticus.text: and whoever lives and believes on me shall never die: believest thou this?

verses.text: and whoever lives and believes on me shall never die: believest thou this?

verses.text: She says to him: Yes, Lord: I have believed that thou art the Christ, the Son of God, he that comes into the world.

sinaiticus.text: And after saying this she went away and called Mary her sister secretly, saying: The Teacher is present, and calls for thee.

verses.text: And after saying this she went away and called Mary her sister secretly, saying: The Teacher is present, and calls for thee.

sinaiticus.text: When she heard, she rose quickly and came to him;

verses.text: When she heard, she rose quickly and came to him;

verses.text: but Jesus had not yet come into the village, but was in the place where Martha had met him.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore the Jews that were with her in the house, and were comforting her, seeing Mary, that she rose up quickly and went out, followed her, supposing that she was going to the tomb, that she might weep there.

verses.text: Therefore the Jews that were with her in the house, and were comforting her, seeing Mary, that she rose up quickly and went out, followed her, supposing that she was going to the tomb, that she might weep there.

sinaiticus.text: Mary therefore, when she came where Jesus was, seeing him, fell at his feet, saying to him: Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother would not have died.

verses.text: Mary therefore, when she came where Jesus was, seeing him, fell at his feet, saying to him: Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother would not have died.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore, when he saw her weeping and the Jews that came

verses.text: Jesus therefore, when he saw her weeping and the Jews that came

sinaiticus.text: and said: Where have you laid him? They say to him: Lord, come and see.

verses.text: and said: Where have you laid him? They say to him: Lord, come and see.

verses.text: Jesus wept.

verses.text: Therefore said the Jews: See how he loved him.

verses.text: But some of them said: Could not this man, that opened the eyes of the blind man, have caused that even this man should not die?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore, again greatly moved within himself, comes to the tomb; but it was a cave, and a stone lay upon it.

verses.text: Jesus therefore, again greatly moved within himself, comes to the tomb; but it was a cave, and a stone lay upon it.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says: Take away the stone. Martha, the sister of him that had died, says to him: Lord, the smell is now offensive; for he has been dead four days.

verses.text: Jesus says: Take away the stone. Martha, the sister of him that had died, says to him: Lord, the smell is now offensive; for he has been dead four days.

verses.text: Jesus says to her: Did I not tell thee that if thou wouldst believe thou shouldst see the glory of God?

sinaiticus.text: They therefore took away the stone; but Jesus lifted up his eyes and said: Father, I thank thee that thou hast heard me.

verses.text: They therefore took away the stone; but Jesus lifted up his eyes and said: Father, I thank thee that thou hast heard me.

sinaiticus.text: But I knew that thou always hearest me; but yet, on account of the multitude that stands around, I said it, that they may believe that thou didst send me.

verses.text: But I knew that thou always hearest me; but yet, on account of the multitude that stands around, I said it, that they may believe that thou didst send me.

verses.text: And having said these things, he cried with a loud voice: Lazarus, come forth.

sinaiticus.text: And he that had been dead came forth, bound hands and feet with swathing bands; and his face was bound around with a handkerchief. Jesus says to them: Loose him, and let him go.

verses.text: And he that had been dead came forth, bound hands and feet with swathing bands; and his face was bound around with a handkerchief. Jesus says to them: Loose him, and let him go.

sinaiticus.text: Many therefore of the Jews, that had come to Mary and had seen what he did, believed on him;

verses.text: Many therefore of the Jews, that had come to Mary and had seen what he did, believed on him;

verses.text: but some of them went away to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore the chief priests and the Pharisees brought together the Sanhedrim, and said: What do we, for this man does many signs?

verses.text: Therefore the chief priests and the Pharisees brought together the Sanhedrim, and said: What do we, for this man does many signs?

sinaiticus.text: If we let him alone thus, all will believe on him; and the Romans will come and take away both our place and nation.

verses.text: If we let him alone thus, all will believe on him; and the Romans will come and take away both our place and nation.

sinaiticus.text: But a certain one of them, Caiaphas, being chief priest that year, said to them: You know nothing,

verses.text: But a certain one of them, Caiaphas, being chief priest that year, said to them: You know nothing,

sinaiticus.text: neither do you consider that it is profitable for us that one man die for the people and not that the whole nation perish.

verses.text: neither do you consider that it is profitable for us that one man die for the people and not that the whole nation perish.

sinaiticus.text: But this he spoke not of himself, but, being chief priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus was about to die for the nation;

verses.text: But this he spoke not of himself, but, being chief priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus was about to die for the nation;

sinaiticus.text: and not for the nation only, but that he might gather into one the children of God also, that were scattered abroad.

verses.text: and not for the nation only, but that he might gather into one the children of God also, that were scattered abroad.

sinaiticus.text: From that day therefore they took counsel to kill him.

verses.text: From that day therefore they took counsel to kill him.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus then no longer walked openly among the Jews; but went away thence into the country near the wilderness, to a city called Ephraim; and there he abode with his disciples.190

verses.text: Jesus then no longer walked openly among the Jews; but went away thence into the country near the wilderness, to a city called Ephraim; and there he abode with his disciples.190

sinaiticus.text: But the passover of the Jews was near, and many went up from the country to Jerusalem before the passover, that they might purify themselves.

verses.text: But the passover of the Jews was near, and many went up from the country to Jerusalem before the passover, that they might purify themselves.

sinaiticus.text: They therefore sought Jesus and said among themselves while standing in the temple: What think you, that he will not come to the feast?

verses.text: They therefore sought Jesus and said among themselves while standing in the temple: What think you, that he will not come to the feast?

sinaiticus.text: But the chief priests and the Pharisees had given commandments that, if any knew where he was, he should make it known, in order that they might take him.

verses.text: But the chief priests and the Pharisees had given commandments that, if any knew where he was, he should make it known, in order that they might take him.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore, six days before the passover, came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, whom Jesus raised from the dead.

verses.text: Jesus therefore, six days before the passover, came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, whom Jesus raised from the dead.

sinaiticus.text: They therefore made him a supper there, and Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those that reclined at table with him.

verses.text: They therefore made him a supper there, and Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those that reclined at table with him.

sinaiticus.text: Then Mary took a pound of the ointment of pure nard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair; and the house was filled with the perfume of the ointment.

verses.text: Then Mary took a pound of the ointment of pure nard, very costly, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair; and the house was filled with the perfume of the ointment.

sinaiticus.text: But Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples, he that was about to deliver him up, says:

verses.text: But Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples, he that was about to deliver him up, says:

verses.text: Why was this ointment not sold for three hundred denarii, and given to the poor?

sinaiticus.text: But this he said, not because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and having the bag he carried what was thrown in.

verses.text: But this he said, not because he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief, and having the bag he carried what was thrown in.
