verses.text: Jesus therefore said: Let her alone; she bought it that she might keep it to the day of my burial.

verses.text: The great multitude of the Jews therefore knew that he was there, and came not because of Jesus only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he raised from the dead.

verses.text: because many of the Jews, on account of him, went away and believed on Jesus.

verses.text: took branches of palm-trees and went forth to meet him, and cried: Hosanna, blessed is he that comes in the name of the Lord, and blessed is the King of Israel.

verses.text: Jesus therefore said to them: Yet a little while the light is among you. Walk while you have the light, that darkness overtake you not; and he that walks in darkness knows not whither he goes.

sinaiticus.text: that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spoke: Lord, who of us has believed what is heard? and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?

verses.text: for they loved the glory of men more than the glory of God.

sinaiticus.text: But Jesus cried and said: He that believes on me believes not on me, but on him that sent me.

sinaiticus.text: And if any one hear my words and keep them not, I judge him not; for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.

verses.text: And if any one hear my words and keep them not, I judge him not; for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.

sinaiticus.text: But no one of those reclining at table knew for what purpose he said this to him;

verses.text: But no one of those reclining at table knew for what purpose he said this to him;

sinaiticus.text: for some supposed, because Judas had the bag, that Jesus said to him: Buy the things of which we have need for the feast, or that he should give something to the poor.

verses.text: for some supposed, because Judas had the bag, that Jesus said to him: Buy the things of which we have need for the feast, or that he should give something to the poor.

sinaiticus.text: Having therefore received the morsel, he went out Immediately; and it was night.

verses.text: Having therefore received the morsel, he went out Immediately; and it was night.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore he had gone out, Jesus said: Now is the Son of man glorified, and God is glorified in him.

verses.text: When therefore he had gone out, Jesus said: Now is the Son of man glorified, and God is glorified in him.

sinaiticus.text: If God is glorified in him. God also will glorify him in himself, and he will immediately glorify him.

verses.text: If God is glorified in him. God also will glorify him in himself, and he will immediately glorify him.

sinaiticus.text: Little children, yet a little while am I with you: you shall seek me, and as I said to the Jews, that where I am you cannot come, to you also I say it now.

verses.text: Little children, yet a little while am I with you: you shall seek me, and as I said to the Jews, that where I am you cannot come, to you also I say it now.

sinaiticus.text: A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another; as I have loved you, that you also love one another.

verses.text: A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another; as I have loved you, that you also love one another.

sinaiticus.text: In this shall all men know that you are my disciples, if you have love one for another.

verses.text: In this shall all men know that you are my disciples, if you have love one for another.

sinaiticus.text: Simon Peter says to him: Lord. whither goest thou? Jesus answered: Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now, but thou shalt follow me hereafter.

verses.text: Simon Peter says to him: Lord. whither goest thou? Jesus answered: Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now, but thou shalt follow me hereafter.

sinaiticus.text: Peter says to him: Lord, why can I not follow thee now? I will lay down my life for thee.

verses.text: Peter says to him: Lord, why can I not follow thee now? I will lay down my life for thee.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered: Wilt thou lay down thy life for me? Verily, verily, I say to thee, a cock shall not crow till thou hast denied me three times.

verses.text: Jesus answered: Wilt thou lay down thy life for me? Verily, verily, I say to thee, a cock shall not crow till thou hast denied me three times.

sinaiticus.text: Let not your hearts be troubled: believe on God, believe also on me.

verses.text: Let not your hearts be troubled: believe on God, believe also on me.

sinaiticus.text: In my Father’s house are many mansions; if not so, I would have told you; for I am going to prepare a place for you.

verses.text: In my Father’s house are many mansions; if not so, I would have told you; for I am going to prepare a place for you.

sinaiticus.text: And when I shall have gone and prepared a place for you, I will come again, and take you to myself, that where I am you also may be.

verses.text: And when I shall have gone and prepared a place for you, I will come again, and take you to myself, that where I am you also may be.

sinaiticus.text: Thomas says to him: Lord, we know not whither thou goest, and how know we the way?

verses.text: Thomas says to him: Lord, we know not whither thou goest, and how know we the way?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to him: I am he way, and the truth, and the life: no one comes to the Father but through me. 7 If you have known me, you shall know my Father also; and even now you know him and lave seen him.

verses.text: Jesus says to him: I am he way, and the truth, and the life: no one comes to the Father but through me. 7 If you have known me, you shall know my Father also; and even now you know him and lave seen him.

sinaiticus.text: Philip says to him: Lord, show us the Father, and it is enough for us.

verses.text: Philip says to him: Lord, show us the Father, and it is enough for us.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to him: So long a time am I with you, and hast thou not known me, Philip? He that has seen me has seen the Father: how sayest thou: show us the Father?

verses.text: Jesus says to him: So long a time am I with you, and hast thou not known me, Philip? He that has seen me has seen the Father: how sayest thou: show us the Father?

sinaiticus.text: Believest thou not that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words that I say to you I speak not of myself: the Father, who abides in me, does the works.

verses.text: Believest thou not that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words that I say to you I speak not of myself: the Father, who abides in me, does the works.

sinaiticus.text: Believe me that I am in the Father and the Father in me: if not, believe because of the works themselves.

verses.text: Believe me that I am in the Father and the Father in me: if not, believe because of the works themselves.

sinaiticus.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, he that believes on me, the works that I do he also shall do, and greater works than these shall he do because I go to the Father.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, he that believes on me, the works that I do he also shall do, and greater works than these shall he do because I go to the Father.

sinaiticus.text: And whatever you shall ask in my name, this will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

verses.text: And whatever you shall ask in my name, this will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.

sinaiticus.text: If you ask any thing in my name. I will do it.

verses.text: If you ask any thing in my name. I will do it.

sinaiticus.text: If you love me, you will keep my commandments.

verses.text: If you love me, you will keep my commandments.

sinaiticus.text: And I will entreat the Father, and anther Advocate will he give you, that he may be with you for ever,

verses.text: And I will entreat the Father, and anther Advocate will he give you, that he may be with you for ever,

sinaiticus.text: the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it sees* him not, neither knows him: you know him, because he abides with you and shall be in you. * Discerns or acknowledges him not

verses.text: the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it sees* him not, neither knows him: you know him, because he abides with you and shall be in you. * Discerns or acknowledges him not

sinaiticus.text: I will not leave you orphans; I am coming to you.

verses.text: I will not leave you orphans; I am coming to you.

sinaiticus.text: Yet a little while and the world sees me no more; but you shall see me; because I live and you shall live.

verses.text: Yet a little while and the world sees me no more; but you shall see me; because I live and you shall live.

sinaiticus.text: In that day you shall know that I am in my Father and you in me and I in you.

verses.text: In that day you shall know that I am in my Father and you in me and I in you.

sinaiticus.text: He that has my commandments and keeps them, he it is that loves me; and he that loves me shall be loved by my Father, and I will love him and will manifest myself to him.

verses.text: He that has my commandments and keeps them, he it is that loves me; and he that loves me shall be loved by my Father, and I will love him and will manifest myself to him.

sinaiticus.text: Judas, not Iscariot, says to him: Lord, and how is it that thou will manifest thyself to us, and not to the world?

verses.text: Judas, not Iscariot, says to him: Lord, and how is it that thou will manifest thyself to us, and not to the world?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered and said to him: If any one love me, he will keep my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our abode with him.

verses.text: Jesus answered and said to him: If any one love me, he will keep my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our abode with him.

sinaiticus.text: He that loves me not keeps not my words; and the word that you hear is not mine, but the Father’s that sent me.196

verses.text: He that loves me not keeps not my words; and the word that you hear is not mine, but the Father’s that sent me.196

sinaiticus.text: These things have I spoken to you while abiding with you;

verses.text: These things have I spoken to you while abiding with you;

sinaiticus.text: but the Advocate, the Holy Spirit whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and shall bring to your remembrance all things that I have said to you.

verses.text: but the Advocate, the Holy Spirit whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and shall bring to your remembrance all things that I have said to you.

sinaiticus.text: Peace I leave you, my peace I give you: not as the world gives, give I to you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.

verses.text: Peace I leave you, my peace I give you: not as the world gives, give I to you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be afraid.

sinaiticus.text: You heard that I said to you: I go away and come to you. If you loved me, you would rejoice because I go to the Father, for the Father is greater than I.

verses.text: You heard that I said to you: I go away and come to you. If you loved me, you would rejoice because I go to the Father, for the Father is greater than I.

sinaiticus.text: And now I have told you before it comes to pass, that when it comes to pass you may believe.

verses.text: And now I have told you before it comes to pass, that when it comes to pass you may believe.

sinaiticus.text: No longer will I talk much with you; for the prince of the world comes, and has nothing in me,

verses.text: No longer will I talk much with you; for the prince of the world comes, and has nothing in me,

sinaiticus.text: but that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father gave me commandment, so I do. Arise, let us go hence.

verses.text: but that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father gave me commandment, so I do. Arise, let us go hence.

sinaiticus.text: I am the true vine, and my Father is the vinedresser.

verses.text: I am the true vine, and my Father is the vinedresser.

sinaiticus.text: Every branch in me that bears not fruit he takes away, and every one that bears fruit, he cleanses, that it may bear more fruit.

verses.text: Every branch in me that bears not fruit he takes away, and every one that bears fruit, he cleanses, that it may bear more fruit.

sinaiticus.text: You are now clean, because of the word that I have spoken to you:

verses.text: You are now clean, because of the word that I have spoken to you:

sinaiticus.text: abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, unless it abide in the vine, so neither can you, unless you abide in me.

verses.text: abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, unless it abide in the vine, so neither can you, unless you abide in me.

sinaiticus.text: I am the vine, you the branches. He that abides in me and I in him, he bears much fruit; for without me you can do nothing.

verses.text: I am the vine, you the branches. He that abides in me and I in him, he bears much fruit; for without me you can do nothing.

sinaiticus.text: If any one abide not in me, he is cast out as the branch and withers, and they gather it and throw it into the fire, and it is burned.

verses.text: If any one abide not in me, he is cast out as the branch and withers, and they gather it and throw it into the fire, and it is burned.

sinaiticus.text: If you abide in me and my words abide in you, ask whatever you will, and it shall be done for you.

verses.text: If you abide in me and my words abide in you, ask whatever you will, and it shall be done for you.

sinaiticus.text: In this is my Father glorified, that you bear much fruit and become my disciples.

verses.text: In this is my Father glorified, that you bear much fruit and become my disciples.

sinaiticus.text: As the Father has loved me, I also have loved you: abide in my love.

verses.text: As the Father has loved me, I also have loved you: abide in my love.

sinaiticus.text: If you keep my commandments, you shall abide in my love, as I have kept my Father’s commandments and abide in his love.

verses.text: If you keep my commandments, you shall abide in my love, as I have kept my Father’s commandments and abide in his love.

sinaiticus.text: These things I have spoken to you that my joy may be in you and your joy may be fulfilled.

verses.text: These things I have spoken to you that my joy may be in you and your joy may be fulfilled.

sinaiticus.text: My commandment is this, that you love one another as I have loved you.

verses.text: My commandment is this, that you love one another as I have loved you.

sinaiticus.text: Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends.

verses.text: Greater love has no one than this, that he lay down his life for his friends.

sinaiticus.text: I no longer call you servants, because the servant knows not what his lord does; but I have called you friends, because An all things that I have heard from my Father I have made known to you.

verses.text: I no longer call you servants, because the servant knows not what his lord does; but I have called you friends, because An all things that I have heard from my Father I have made known to you.

sinaiticus.text: You have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and appointed you that you may go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain, that whatever you ask the Father in my name he may give you.

verses.text: You have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and appointed you that you may go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should remain, that whatever you ask the Father in my name he may give you.

sinaiticus.text: These things I command you, that you love one another.

verses.text: These things I command you, that you love one another.

sinaiticus.text: If the world hates you, you know that it has hated me first.

verses.text: If the world hates you, you know that it has hated me first.

sinaiticus.text: If you were of the world, the world would love its own; but because you are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

verses.text: If you were of the world, the world would love its own; but because you are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.

sinaiticus.text: Remember the word that I spoke to you: The servant is not greater than his lord. If they have persecuted me, they will persecute you also: if they have kept my word, they will keep yours also.

verses.text: Remember the word that I spoke to you: The servant is not greater than his lord. If they have persecuted me, they will persecute you also: if they have kept my word, they will keep yours also.

sinaiticus.text: But all these things will they do to you on account of my name, because they know not him that sent me.

verses.text: But all these things will they do to you on account of my name, because they know not him that sent me.

sinaiticus.text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.

verses.text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have had sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin.

sinaiticus.text: He that hates me hates my Father also.

verses.text: He that hates me hates my Father also.

sinaiticus.text: If I had not done among them the works that no other did, they would have had no sin; but now they have both seen and hated both me and my Father.

verses.text: If I had not done among them the works that no other did, they would have had no sin; but now they have both seen and hated both me and my Father.

sinaiticus.text: But that the word might be fulfilled which is written in their law: They hated me without a cause.

verses.text: But that the word might be fulfilled which is written in their law: They hated me without a cause.

sinaiticus.text: When the Advocate has come, whom I will send you from the Father, the Spirit of truth that proceeds from the Father, he shall testify of me;

verses.text: When the Advocate has come, whom I will send you from the Father, the Spirit of truth that proceeds from the Father, he shall testify of me;

sinaiticus.text: and you also shall testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.

verses.text: and you also shall testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.

sinaiticus.text: These things have I spoken to you that you may not be offended.

verses.text: These things have I spoken to you that you may not be offended.

sinaiticus.text: They will put you out of the synagogues: indeed, the hour comes that every one that kills you will think that he offers service to God.

verses.text: They will put you out of the synagogues: indeed, the hour comes that every one that kills you will think that he offers service to God.

sinaiticus.text: And these things will they do because they have not known the Father nor me.

verses.text: And these things will they do because they have not known the Father nor me.

sinaiticus.text: But these things I have spoken to you that when the hour comes you may remember them, that I told you. And these things I told you not from the beginning, because I was with you.

verses.text: But these things I have spoken to you that when the hour comes you may remember them, that I told you. And these things I told you not from the beginning, because I was with you.

sinaiticus.text: But now I go to him that sent me, and no one of you asks me: Whither goest thou?

verses.text: But now I go to him that sent me, and no one of you asks me: Whither goest thou?

sinaiticus.text: And yet, because I have told you these things, sorrow has filled your heart.198

verses.text: And yet, because I have told you these things, sorrow has filled your heart.198

sinaiticus.text: But I tell you the truth, it is profitable for you that I go away. For if I go not away, the Advocate will not come to you; but if I go, I will send him to you.

verses.text: But I tell you the truth, it is profitable for you that I go away. For if I go not away, the Advocate will not come to you; but if I go, I will send him to you.

sinaiticus.text: And when he comes, he will convince the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment.

verses.text: And when he comes, he will convince the world of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment.

sinaiticus.text: Of sin indeed, because they believe not on me;

verses.text: Of sin indeed, because they believe not on me;

sinaiticus.text: but of righteousness, because I go to the Father and you see me no more;

verses.text: but of righteousness, because I go to the Father and you see me no more;

sinaiticus.text: but of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

verses.text: but of judgment, because the prince of this world is judged.

sinaiticus.text: I have yet many things to say to you, but you cannot bear them now;

verses.text: I have yet many things to say to you, but you cannot bear them now;

sinaiticus.text: but when he has come, the Spirit of truth, he shall guide you in all the truth; for he shall not speak of himself, but whatever he hears he shall speak, and he shall announce to you things to come.

verses.text: but when he has come, the Spirit of truth, he shall guide you in all the truth; for he shall not speak of himself, but whatever he hears he shall speak, and he shall announce to you things to come.

sinaiticus.text: He shall glorify me, for he shall take of mine and announce it to you.

verses.text: He shall glorify me, for he shall take of mine and announce it to you.

sinaiticus.text: All things whatever the Father has are mine: therefore I said that he takes of mine and announces to you.

verses.text: All things whatever the Father has are mine: therefore I said that he takes of mine and announces to you.

sinaiticus.text: A little while, and you see me no more, and again a little while, and you shall see me.

verses.text: A little while, and you see me no more, and again a little while, and you shall see me.

sinaiticus.text: Some of his disciples therefore said one to another: What is this that he says to us: A little while, and you see me not, and again a little while, and you shall see me? and that 1 go to the Father?

verses.text: Some of his disciples therefore said one to another: What is this that he says to us: A little while, and you see me not, and again a little while, and you shall see me? and that 1 go to the Father?

sinaiticus.text: They said therefore: This, what is it that he says, The little while? We know not what he says.

verses.text: They said therefore: This, what is it that he says, The little while? We know not what he says.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus knew that they desired to ask him, and he said to them: Concerning this do you inquire among yourselves because I said: A little while, and you see me not, and again a little while, and you shall see me?

verses.text: Jesus knew that they desired to ask him, and he said to them: Concerning this do you inquire among yourselves because I said: A little while, and you see me not, and again a little while, and you shall see me?

sinaiticus.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, that you shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: you shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall become joy.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, that you shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: you shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall become joy.

sinaiticus.text: The wife, when she is in labor, has sorrow, because her hour has come; but when she has brought forth the child, she no longer remembers the affliction for joy that a man has been born into the world.

verses.text: The wife, when she is in labor, has sorrow, because her hour has come; but when she has brought forth the child, she no longer remembers the affliction for joy that a man has been born into the world.

sinaiticus.text: And you therefore now indeed have sorrow; but I shall see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no one takes from you.

verses.text: And you therefore now indeed have sorrow; but I shall see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no one takes from you.

sinaiticus.text: And in that day, of me you shall ask nothing. Verily, verily, I say to you, if you ask anything of the Father, he will give it to you in my name.

verses.text: And in that day, of me you shall ask nothing. Verily, verily, I say to you, if you ask anything of the Father, he will give it to you in my name.

sinaiticus.text: Till now you have asked nothing in my name: ask, and you shall

verses.text: Till now you have asked nothing in my name: ask, and you shall

sinaiticus.text: These things I have spoken to you in parables: the hour comes when I will no longer speak to you in parables, but will tell you plainly concerning the Father.

verses.text: These things I have spoken to you in parables: the hour comes when I will no longer speak to you in parables, but will tell you plainly concerning the Father.

sinaiticus.text: In that day you shall ask in my name, and 1 say not to you that I will beseech the Father for you;

verses.text: In that day you shall ask in my name, and 1 say not to you that I will beseech the Father for you;

sinaiticus.text: for the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me, and have believed that I came forth from God.

verses.text: for the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me, and have believed that I came forth from God.

sinaiticus.text: I came forth from the Father, and have come into the world: again I leave the world and go to the Father.

verses.text: I came forth from the Father, and have come into the world: again I leave the world and go to the Father.

sinaiticus.text: His disciples say: Behold, now thou speakest plainly, and utterest no parable.

verses.text: His disciples say: Behold, now thou speakest plainly, and utterest no parable.

sinaiticus.text: Now we know that thou knowest all things, and hast no need that any one should ask thee: in this we believe that thou earnest forth from God.

verses.text: Now we know that thou knowest all things, and hast no need that any one should ask thee: in this we believe that thou earnest forth from God.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered them: Do you now believe?

verses.text: Jesus answered them: Do you now believe?

sinaiticus.text: Behold, the hour comes, and has come, that you shall be scattered each one to his own and leave me alone; and yet I am not alone, for the Father is with me.

verses.text: Behold, the hour comes, and has come, that you shall be scattered each one to his own and leave me alone; and yet I am not alone, for the Father is with me.

sinaiticus.text: These things I have spoken to you that in me you may have peace. In the world you have affliction; but take courage, I have overcome the world.

verses.text: These things I have spoken to you that in me you may have peace. In the world you have affliction; but take courage, I have overcome the world.

sinaiticus.text: These things spoke Jesus; and, lifting his eyes to heaven, he said: Father, the hour has come: glorify thy Son, that the Son may glorify thee,

verses.text: These things spoke Jesus; and, lifting his eyes to heaven, he said: Father, the hour has come: glorify thy Son, that the Son may glorify thee,

sinaiticus.text: as thou hast given him authority over all flesh, that to all that thou hast given him he may give them life eternal.

verses.text: as thou hast given him authority over all flesh, that to all that thou hast given him he may give them life eternal.

sinaiticus.text: But eternal life is this, that they may know thee, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.

verses.text: But eternal life is this, that they may know thee, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom thou hast sent.

sinaiticus.text: I have glorified thee on the earth, having finished the work that thou gavest me to do;

verses.text: I have glorified thee on the earth, having finished the work that thou gavest me to do;

sinaiticus.text: and now, Father, glorify thou me with thyself with the glory that I had with thee before the world was.

verses.text: and now, Father, glorify thou me with thyself with the glory that I had with thee before the world was.

sinaiticus.text: I have manifested thy name to the men whom thou gavest me out of the world. Thine they were, and thou gavest them to me, and they have kept thy word;

verses.text: I have manifested thy name to the men whom thou gavest me out of the world. Thine they were, and thou gavest them to me, and they have kept thy word;

sinaiticus.text: now they know that all things whatever thou hast given me are from thee;

verses.text: now they know that all things whatever thou hast given me are from thee;

sinaiticus.text: for the words that thou gavest me I have given them, and they have received them, and have known in truth that I came forth from thee, and have believed that thou didst send me.

verses.text: for the words that thou gavest me I have given them, and they have received them, and have known in truth that I came forth from thee, and have believed that thou didst send me.

sinaiticus.text: I pray for them; I pray not for the world, but for those that thou hast given me, for they are thine,200

verses.text: I pray for them; I pray not for the world, but for those that thou hast given me, for they are thine,200

sinaiticus.text: and all mine are thine, and thine are mine, and I have been glorified in them.

verses.text: and all mine are thine, and thine are mine, and I have been glorified in them.

sinaiticus.text: And I am no longer in the world, and these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep them in my name that thou hast given me, that they may be one, as we.

verses.text: And I am no longer in the world, and these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep them in my name that thou hast given me, that they may be one, as we.

sinaiticus.text: When I was with them I kept them in thy name that thou hast given me, and I have guarded them, and no one of them is lost but the son of perdition, that the Scripture may be fulfilled.

verses.text: When I was with them I kept them in thy name that thou hast given me, and I have guarded them, and no one of them is lost but the son of perdition, that the Scripture may be fulfilled.

sinaiticus.text: But now I come to thee, and these things I speak in the world, that they may have my joy fulfilled in themselves.

verses.text: But now I come to thee, and these things I speak in the world, that they may have my joy fulfilled in themselves.

sinaiticus.text: I have given them thy word, and the world has hated them, because they are not of the world as I am not of the world.

verses.text: I have given them thy word, and the world has hated them, because they are not of the world as I am not of the world.

sinaiticus.text: I pray not that thou take them out of the world, but that thou keep them from the evil one.

verses.text: I pray not that thou take them out of the world, but that thou keep them from the evil one.

sinaiticus.text: They are not of the world, as I am not of the world.

verses.text: They are not of the world, as I am not of the world.

sinaiticus.text: Sanctify them in the truth: thy word is truth.

verses.text: Sanctify them in the truth: thy word is truth.

sinaiticus.text: As thou didst send me into the world, I sent them into the world;

verses.text: As thou didst send me into the world, I sent them into the world;

sinaiticus.text: and for them I sanctify myself, that they also may be sanctified in the truth.

verses.text: and for them I sanctify myself, that they also may be sanctified in the truth.

sinaiticus.text: But not for these only do I pray, but also for those that believe on me through their word,

verses.text: But not for these only do I pray, but also for those that believe on me through their word,

sinaiticus.text: that they all may be one, as thou. Father, art in me and I in thee, that they also may be in us, that the world may believe that thou didst send me.

verses.text: that they all may be one, as thou. Father, art in me and I in thee, that they also may be in us, that the world may believe that thou didst send me.

sinaiticus.text: And the glory that thou hast given me I have given them, that they may be one as we are one:

verses.text: And the glory that thou hast given me I have given them, that they may be one as we are one:

sinaiticus.text: I in them and thou in me, that they may be perfected into one, that the world may know that thou hast sent me and hast loved them as thou hast loved me.

verses.text: I in them and thou in me, that they may be perfected into one, that the world may know that thou hast sent me and hast loved them as thou hast loved me.

sinaiticus.text: Father, as to what thou hast given me, I would that they also be with me where I am, that they may see my glory, which thou hast given me because thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world.

verses.text: Father, as to what thou hast given me, I would that they also be with me where I am, that they may see my glory, which thou hast given me because thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world.

sinaiticus.text: Righteous Father, though the world has not known thee, yet I have known thee, and these have known that thou didst send me;

verses.text: Righteous Father, though the world has not known thee, yet I have known thee, and these have known that thou didst send me;

sinaiticus.text: and I have made known to them thy name, and will make it known, that the love with which thou hast loved me may be in them and I in them.

verses.text: and I have made known to them thy name, and will make it known, that the love with which thou hast loved me may be in them and I in them.

sinaiticus.text: Having said these things, Jesus went forth with his disciples beyond the brook of Cedar, where was a garden, into which he entered,

verses.text: Having said these things, Jesus went forth with his disciples beyond the brook of Cedar, where was a garden, into which he entered,

sinaiticus.text: But Judas, also, who delivered him up, knew the place, because Jesus had often gone thither in company with his disciples.

verses.text: But Judas, also, who delivered him up, knew the place, because Jesus had often gone thither in company with his disciples.

sinaiticus.text: Judas therefore, having received the band, the attendants from the chief priests and from the Pharisees, comes thither with torches and lamps and weapons.

verses.text: Judas therefore, having received the band, the attendants from the chief priests and from the Pharisees, comes thither with torches and lamps and weapons.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that were coming upon him, went forth and said to them: Whom seek you?

verses.text: Jesus therefore, knowing all things that were coming upon him, went forth and said to them: Whom seek you?

sinaiticus.text: They answered him: Jesus the Nazarene. Jesus says to them: I am he. But Judas also, who delivered him up, stood with them.

verses.text: They answered him: Jesus the Nazarene. Jesus says to them: I am he. But Judas also, who delivered him up, stood with them.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore he said to them: I am he, they went back and fell on the ground.

verses.text: When therefore he said to them: I am he, they went back and fell on the ground.

sinaiticus.text: Again therefore he asked them: Whom seek you? And they said: Jesus the Nazarene.

verses.text: Again therefore he asked them: Whom seek you? And they said: Jesus the Nazarene.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered: I told you that I am he: if then ye seek me, let these go away.

verses.text: Jesus answered: I told you that I am he: if then ye seek me, let these go away.

sinaiticus.text: That the word might be fulfilled which he spoke: Of those that thou hast given me I have lost none.

verses.text: That the word might be fulfilled which he spoke: Of those that thou hast given me I have lost none.

sinaiticus.text: Simon Peter therefore, having a sword, drew it and struck the servant of the chief priest, and cut off his right ear; and the name of the servant was Malchus.

verses.text: Simon Peter therefore, having a sword, drew it and struck the servant of the chief priest, and cut off his right ear; and the name of the servant was Malchus.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus then said to Peter: Put the sword into the sheath. The cup that the Father has given me, shall I not drink it?

verses.text: Jesus then said to Peter: Put the sword into the sheath. The cup that the Father has given me, shall I not drink it?

sinaiticus.text: Therefore the band and the officer and the attendants of the Jews took Jesus and bound him,

verses.text: Therefore the band and the officer and the attendants of the Jews took Jesus and bound him,

sinaiticus.text: and led him to Annas first; for he was father-in-law of Caiaphas who was chief priest that year.

verses.text: and led him to Annas first; for he was father-in-law of Caiaphas who was chief priest that year.

sinaiticus.text: and it was Caiaphas that advised the Jews that it was profitable that one man should die for the people.

verses.text: and it was Caiaphas that advised the Jews that it was profitable that one man should die for the people.

sinaiticus.text: But there followed Jesus, Simon Peter and another disciple. And that disciple was acquainted with the chief priest, and went with Jesus into the court of the chief priest,

verses.text: But there followed Jesus, Simon Peter and another disciple. And that disciple was acquainted with the chief priest, and went with Jesus into the court of the chief priest,

sinaiticus.text: but Peter stood at the gate without. Then the other disciple, the acquaintance of the chief priest, went in and spoke to the doorkeeper, and brought Peter in.

verses.text: but Peter stood at the gate without. Then the other disciple, the acquaintance of the chief priest, went in and spoke to the doorkeeper, and brought Peter in.

sinaiticus.text: Then the maidservant that kept the door says to Peter: Art not thou also of the disciples of this man? He says: I am not.

verses.text: Then the maidservant that kept the door says to Peter: Art not thou also of the disciples of this man? He says: I am not.

sinaiticus.text: But the servants and the attendants, having made a fire of coals, for it was cold, were standing and warming them selves; and Peter also was standing with them and warming himself.

verses.text: But the servants and the attendants, having made a fire of coals, for it was cold, were standing and warming them selves; and Peter also was standing with them and warming himself.

sinaiticus.text: Then the chief priest asked Jesus concerning his disciples and concerning his teaching.

verses.text: Then the chief priest asked Jesus concerning his disciples and concerning his teaching.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered him: I have spoken plainly to the world: I have always taught in a synagogue and in the temple, where all the Jews come together, and in secret have I spoken nothing.202

verses.text: Jesus answered him: I have spoken plainly to the world: I have always taught in a synagogue and in the temple, where all the Jews come together, and in secret have I spoken nothing.202

sinaiticus.text: Why dost thou ask me? Ask those that have heard what I spoke to them: behold, these know what I said.

verses.text: Why dost thou ask me? Ask those that have heard what I spoke to them: behold, these know what I said.

sinaiticus.text: But when he had spoken this, one of the attendants that stood by struck Jesus with his open hand, saying: Answerest thou the chief priest thus?

verses.text: But when he had spoken this, one of the attendants that stood by struck Jesus with his open hand, saying: Answerest thou the chief priest thus?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered him: If I have spoken evil, testify of the evil; but if well, why smitest thou me?

verses.text: Jesus answered him: If I have spoken evil, testify of the evil; but if well, why smitest thou me?

sinaiticus.text: Annas then sent him, bound, to Caiaphas the chief priest.

verses.text: Annas then sent him, bound, to Caiaphas the chief priest.

sinaiticus.text: But Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They then said to him: Art not thou also of his disciples? He denied and said: I am not.

verses.text: But Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They then said to him: Art not thou also of his disciples? He denied and said: I am not.

sinaiticus.text: One of the servants of the chief priest, being a relative of him whose ear Peter had cut off, says: Did I not see thee in the garden with him?

verses.text: One of the servants of the chief priest, being a relative of him whose ear Peter had cut off, says: Did I not see thee in the garden with him?

sinaiticus.text: Again therefore Peter denied; and immediately a cock crew.

verses.text: Again therefore Peter denied; and immediately a cock crew.

sinaiticus.text: Then they lead Jesus from Caiaphas to the pretorium; and it was early morn. And they went not into the pretorium, that they might not be defiled, but that they might eat the passover.

verses.text: Then they lead Jesus from Caiaphas to the pretorium; and it was early morn. And they went not into the pretorium, that they might not be defiled, but that they might eat the passover.

sinaiticus.text: Pilate therefore came forth to them and said: What accusation bring you against this man?

verses.text: Pilate therefore came forth to them and said: What accusation bring you against this man?

sinaiticus.text: They answered and said to him: If this man had not done evil, we would not have delivered him to thee.

verses.text: They answered and said to him: If this man had not done evil, we would not have delivered him to thee.

sinaiticus.text: Pilate therefore said to them: Take you him and judge him according to your law. The Jews then said to him: It is not lawful for us to put any one to death:

verses.text: Pilate therefore said to them: Take you him and judge him according to your law. The Jews then said to him: It is not lawful for us to put any one to death:

sinaiticus.text: that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spoke signifying by what kind of death he was about to die.

verses.text: that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spoke signifying by what kind of death he was about to die.

sinaiticus.text: Then Pilate entered the pretorium again, and called Jesus and said to him: Art thou the King of the Jews?

verses.text: Then Pilate entered the pretorium again, and called Jesus and said to him: Art thou the King of the Jews?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered: Sayest thou this of thyself, or did others tell thee of me?

verses.text: Jesus answered: Sayest thou this of thyself, or did others tell thee of me?

sinaiticus.text: Pilate answered: Am I a Jew? Thy nation and the chief priests delivered thee to me: what hast thou done?

verses.text: Pilate answered: Am I a Jew? Thy nation and the chief priests delivered thee to me: what hast thou done?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered: My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world my servants would fight, that might not be delivered to the Jews; but now my kingdom is not hence,

verses.text: Jesus answered: My kingdom is not of this world. If my kingdom were of this world my servants would fight, that might not be delivered to the Jews; but now my kingdom is not hence,

sinaiticus.text: Pilate then said to him: Art thou not then a king? Jesus answered: Thou sayest, for I am a king. To this end was I born, and to this end have I come into the world, that I might testify to the truth: every one that is of the truth hears my voice.

verses.text: Pilate then said to him: Art thou not then a king? Jesus answered: Thou sayest, for I am a king. To this end was I born, and to this end have I come into the world, that I might testify to the truth: every one that is of the truth hears my voice.

sinaiticus.text: Pilate says to him: What is truth? And having said this. he went out again to the Jews, and said to them: I find no fault in him.

verses.text: Pilate says to him: What is truth? And having said this. he went out again to the Jews, and said to them: I find no fault in him.

sinaiticus.text: But you have a custom that I release to you one at the passover:

verses.text: But you have a custom that I release to you one at the passover:

sinaiticus.text: They then cried out again, saying: Not this man, but Barabbas. But Barabbas was a robber.

verses.text: They then cried out again, saying: Not this man, but Barabbas. But Barabbas was a robber.

sinaiticus.text: Pilate therefore then took Jesus and scourged him.

verses.text: Pilate therefore then took Jesus and scourged him.

sinaiticus.text: And the soldiers plaited a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and threw a purple garment around him,

verses.text: And the soldiers plaited a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and threw a purple garment around him,

sinaiticus.text: and came to him and said: Hail, King of the Jews; and they struck him with the open hand.

verses.text: and came to him and said: Hail, King of the Jews; and they struck him with the open hand.

sinaiticus.text: Pilate again came forth and said to them, Behold, I bring him forth to you, that you may know that I find no fault.

verses.text: Pilate again came forth and said to them, Behold, I bring him forth to you, that you may know that I find no fault.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore came forth wearing the crown of thorns and purple garment. And he says to them: Behold the man.

verses.text: Jesus therefore came forth wearing the crown of thorns and purple garment. And he says to them: Behold the man.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore when the chief priests and the attendants saw him, they cried out: Crucify, crucify. Pilate says to them: Take you him and crucify him; for I find no fault in him.

verses.text: Therefore when the chief priests and the attendants saw him, they cried out: Crucify, crucify. Pilate says to them: Take you him and crucify him; for I find no fault in him.

sinaiticus.text: The Jews answered: We have a law, and according to the law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.

verses.text: The Jews answered: We have a law, and according to the law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.

sinaiticus.text: Thereupon when Pilate heard this word, he was the more afraid,

verses.text: Thereupon when Pilate heard this word, he was the more afraid,

sinaiticus.text: and went into the pretorium again, and said to Jesus: Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer.

verses.text: and went into the pretorium again, and said to Jesus: Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer.

sinaiticus.text: Pilate says to him: Speakest thou not to me? Knowest thou not that I have authority to release thee and authority to crucify thee?

verses.text: Pilate says to him: Speakest thou not to me? Knowest thou not that I have authority to release thee and authority to crucify thee?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus answered: Thou couldst have had no authority against me, unless it had been given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me to thee has the greater sin.

verses.text: Jesus answered: Thou couldst have had no authority against me, unless it had been given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me to thee has the greater sin.

sinaiticus.text: After this Pilate sought to release him; but the Jews cried out, saying: If thou release this man, thou art not a friend of Caesar: every one that makes himself king speaks against Caesar.

verses.text: After this Pilate sought to release him; but the Jews cried out, saying: If thou release this man, thou art not a friend of Caesar: every one that makes himself king speaks against Caesar.

sinaiticus.text: Then Pilate, after hearing these words, brought Jesus forth, and sat on the judgment-seat in a place called The Pavement, but in Hebrew, Gabbatha.

verses.text: Then Pilate, after hearing these words, brought Jesus forth, and sat on the judgment-seat in a place called The Pavement, but in Hebrew, Gabbatha.

sinaiticus.text: And it was the preparation of the passover: it was about the sixth hour. And he says to the Jews: Behold your king.

verses.text: And it was the preparation of the passover: it was about the sixth hour. And he says to the Jews: Behold your king.

sinaiticus.text: They therefore cried out: Away with him, away with him, crucify him. Pilate says to them: Shall I crucify your king? The chief priests answered: We have no king but Caesar.

verses.text: They therefore cried out: Away with him, away with him, crucify him. Pilate says to them: Shall I crucify your king? The chief priests answered: We have no king but Caesar.

sinaiticus.text: Then therefore he delivered him to them to be crucified. They therefore took Jesus;

verses.text: Then therefore he delivered him to them to be crucified. They therefore took Jesus;

sinaiticus.text: and bearing the cross for himself, he went forth to a place called the place of a skull, which is called in Hebrew Golgotha,

verses.text: and bearing the cross for himself, he went forth to a place called the place of a skull, which is called in Hebrew Golgotha,

sinaiticus.text: where they crucified him, and with him two others, on this side and on that, but Jesus in the midst.204

verses.text: where they crucified him, and with him two others, on this side and on that, but Jesus in the midst.204

sinaiticus.text: But Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross; and it was written: JESUS THE NAZARENE, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

verses.text: But Pilate wrote a title and put it on the cross; and it was written: JESUS THE NAZARENE, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

sinaiticus.text: Many of the Jews therefore read this title, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, in Greek.

verses.text: Many of the Jews therefore read this title, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city; and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, in Greek.

sinaiticus.text: The chief priests of the Jews then said to, Pilate: Write not: The king of the Jews, but that he said: I am the king of the Jews.

verses.text: The chief priests of the Jews then said to, Pilate: Write not: The king of the Jews, but that he said: I am the king of the Jews.

sinaiticus.text: Pilate answered: What I have written, I have written.

verses.text: Pilate answered: What I have written, I have written.

sinaiticus.text: The soldiers therefore, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments, and made four parts, for each soldier a part, and his coat. But the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.

verses.text: The soldiers therefore, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments, and made four parts, for each soldier a part, and his coat. But the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.

sinaiticus.text: They said therefore one to another: Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be. That the scripture might be fulfilled: They divided my garments among them, and on my raiment they cast lots. These things therefore the soldiers did.

verses.text: They said therefore one to another: Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be. That the scripture might be fulfilled: They divided my garments among them, and on my raiment they cast lots. These things therefore the soldiers did.

sinaiticus.text: But there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Cleopas, and Mary Magdalene.

verses.text: But there stood by the cross of Jesus his mother and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Cleopas, and Mary Magdalene.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore seeing his mother, and the disciple whom he loved standing by, says to his mother: Woman, behold thy son.

verses.text: Jesus therefore seeing his mother, and the disciple whom he loved standing by, says to his mother: Woman, behold thy son.

sinaiticus.text: Then he says to the disciple: Behold thy mother. And from that hour the disciple took her to his own home.

verses.text: Then he says to the disciple: Behold thy mother. And from that hour the disciple took her to his own home.

sinaiticus.text: After this, Jesus, knowing that all things had been already finished, that the scripture might be fulfilled, says: I thirst.

verses.text: After this, Jesus, knowing that all things had been already finished, that the scripture might be fulfilled, says: I thirst.

sinaiticus.text: There lay a vessel full of vinegar: having therefore put a sponge full of vinegar on hyssop, they put it to his mouth.

verses.text: There lay a vessel full of vinegar: having therefore put a sponge full of vinegar on hyssop, they put it to his mouth.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore he had received the vinegar, he said: It is finished; and having bowed his head, he gave up the spirit.

verses.text: When therefore he had received the vinegar, he said: It is finished; and having bowed his head, he gave up the spirit.

sinaiticus.text: The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies might not remain on the cross during the sabbath, for that sabbath was a great day, besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

verses.text: The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies might not remain on the cross during the sabbath, for that sabbath was a great day, besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.

sinaiticus.text: Then came the soldiers and broke the legs of the first, and of the other that was crucified with him;

verses.text: Then came the soldiers and broke the legs of the first, and of the other that was crucified with him;

sinaiticus.text: but coming to Jesus, when they saw him already dead, they broke not his legs;

verses.text: but coming to Jesus, when they saw him already dead, they broke not his legs;

sinaiticus.text: but one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and immediately there came forth blood and water.

verses.text: but one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and immediately there came forth blood and water.

sinaiticus.text: And he that saw it has testified, and his testimony is true, and he knows that he speaks what is true, that you also may believe.

verses.text: And he that saw it has testified, and his testimony is true, and he knows that he speaks what is true, that you also may believe.

sinaiticus.text: For these things took place that the scripture might be fulfilled: A bone of him shall not be broken.

verses.text: For these things took place that the scripture might be fulfilled: A bone of him shall not be broken.

sinaiticus.text: And again another scripture says: They shall look on him whom

verses.text: And again another scripture says: They shall look on him whom

sinaiticus.text: But after these things Joseph, who was of Arimathea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus; and Pilate gave permission. They came therefore and took him away.

verses.text: But after these things Joseph, who was of Arimathea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, besought Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus; and Pilate gave permission. They came therefore and took him away.

sinaiticus.text: But Nicodemus also came, he that had come to him by night at the first, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds.

verses.text: But Nicodemus also came, he that had come to him by night at the first, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds.

sinaiticus.text: They therefore took the body of Jesus, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as is the custom of the Jews to prepare for burial.

verses.text: They therefore took the body of Jesus, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as is the custom of the Jews to prepare for burial.

sinaiticus.text: But there was, in the place where he had been crucified, a garden, and in the garden a new sepulcher, in which no one had ever yet been laid.

verses.text: But there was, in the place where he had been crucified, a garden, and in the garden a new sepulcher, in which no one had ever yet been laid.

sinaiticus.text: There then because of the preparation of the Jews, for the sepulcher was near, laid they Jesus.

verses.text: There then because of the preparation of the Jews, for the sepulcher was near, laid they Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: But on the first of the week, Mary Magdalene comes to the sepulcher early, it being yet dark, and sees the stone taken away from the sepulcher.

verses.text: But on the first of the week, Mary Magdalene comes to the sepulcher early, it being yet dark, and sees the stone taken away from the sepulcher.

sinaiticus.text: She therefore runs and comes to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and says to them: They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulcher, and we know not where they have laid him.

verses.text: She therefore runs and comes to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and says to them: They have taken away the Lord out of the sepulcher, and we know not where they have laid him.

sinaiticus.text: Thereupon Peter went forth and the other disciple, and came to the sepulcher.

verses.text: Thereupon Peter went forth and the other disciple, and came to the sepulcher.

sinaiticus.text: But the two ran together; and the other disciple outran Peter, and came first to the sepulcher;

verses.text: But the two ran together; and the other disciple outran Peter, and came first to the sepulcher;

sinaiticus.text: and having stooped down, he saw the linen cloths lying: however he went not in.

verses.text: and having stooped down, he saw the linen cloths lying: however he went not in.

sinaiticus.text: Then comes Simon Peter following him; and he went into the sepulcher, and saw the linen cloths lying,

verses.text: Then comes Simon Peter following him; and he went into the sepulcher, and saw the linen cloths lying,

sinaiticus.text: and the handkerchief, which was on his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but folded up in a place by itself.

verses.text: and the handkerchief, which was on his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but folded up in a place by itself.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, the other disciple also that came first to the sepulcher then went in, and saw and believed;

verses.text: Therefore, the other disciple also that came first to the sepulcher then went in, and saw and believed;

sinaiticus.text: for they not yet knew the scripture, that he must rise from the dead.

verses.text: for they not yet knew the scripture, that he must rise from the dead.

sinaiticus.text: The disciples then went away again to their homes.

verses.text: The disciples then went away again to their homes.

sinaiticus.text: But Mary stood without at the sepulcher weeping. Then as she wept, she stooped down and looked into the sepulcher,

verses.text: But Mary stood without at the sepulcher weeping. Then as she wept, she stooped down and looked into the sepulcher,

sinaiticus.text: and saw two angels in white, sitting, one at the head and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.

verses.text: and saw two angels in white, sitting, one at the head and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.

sinaiticus.text: They say to her: Woman, why weepest thou? She says to them: They have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid206 him. Having said these things, she turned back, and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.

verses.text: They say to her: Woman, why weepest thou? She says to them: They have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid206 him. Having said these things, she turned back, and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to her: Woman, why weepest thou? Whom seekest thou? She, supposing that he was the gardener, says to him: Sir, if thou hast borne him away, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.

verses.text: Jesus says to her: Woman, why weepest thou? Whom seekest thou? She, supposing that he was the gardener, says to him: Sir, if thou hast borne him away, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus said to her: Mary. She turned and said to him in Hebrew: Rabboni, which is called, Teacher.

verses.text: Jesus said to her: Mary. She turned and said to him in Hebrew: Rabboni, which is called, Teacher.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to her: Touch me not; for I have not yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brethren and say to them: I ascend to my Father and your Father, and to my God and your God.

verses.text: Jesus says to her: Touch me not; for I have not yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brethren and say to them: I ascend to my Father and your Father, and to my God and your God.

sinaiticus.text: Mary Magdalene comes and tells the disciples: I have seen the Lord; and that he had said these things to her.

verses.text: Mary Magdalene comes and tells the disciples: I have seen the Lord; and that he had said these things to her.

sinaiticus.text: When therefore evening had come on that day, the first of the week, and the doors had been closed where the disciples were for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them: Peace to you.

verses.text: When therefore evening had come on that day, the first of the week, and the doors had been closed where the disciples were for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and said to them: Peace to you.

sinaiticus.text: And having said this, he showed them his hands and his side. Thereupon the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.

verses.text: And having said this, he showed them his hands and his side. Thereupon the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: He then said to them again: Peace to you; as the Father has sent me, I also send you.

verses.text: He then said to them again: Peace to you; as the Father has sent me, I also send you.

sinaiticus.text: And having said this, he breathed on them and said to them: Receive the Holy Spirit.

verses.text: And having said this, he breathed on them and said to them: Receive the Holy Spirit.

sinaiticus.text: Whosesoever sins you forgive, they are forgiven them; whosesoever sins you retain, they are retained.

verses.text: Whosesoever sins you forgive, they are forgiven them; whosesoever sins you retain, they are retained.

sinaiticus.text: But Thomas, who is called Didymus, one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.

verses.text: But Thomas, who is called Didymus, one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.

sinaiticus.text: The other disciples therefore said to him: We have seen the Lord. But he said to them: Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the place of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.

verses.text: The other disciples therefore said to him: We have seen the Lord. But he said to them: Unless I see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the place of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.

sinaiticus.text: And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them. Jesus came, the doors having been shut, and stood in the midst, and said: Peace to you.

verses.text: And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them. Jesus came, the doors having been shut, and stood in the midst, and said: Peace to you.

sinaiticus.text: Then he says to Thomas: Reach hither thy finger, and behold my hands, and reach thy hand, and put it into my side, and be not faithless, but believing.

verses.text: Then he says to Thomas: Reach hither thy finger, and behold my hands, and reach thy hand, and put it into my side, and be not faithless, but believing.

sinaiticus.text: Thomas answered and said to him: My Lord and my God.

verses.text: Thomas answered and said to him: My Lord and my God.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to him: Because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed are they that, though not seeing, have yet believed.

verses.text: Jesus says to him: Because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed are they that, though not seeing, have yet believed.

sinaiticus.text: Many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book;

verses.text: Many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book;

sinaiticus.text: but these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ,

verses.text: but these are written that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ,

sinaiticus.text: After these things Jesus manifested himself to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias: and he manifested himself thus.

verses.text: After these things Jesus manifested himself to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias: and he manifested himself thus.

sinaiticus.text: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas who is called Didymus, and Nathaniel who was from Cana of Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples.

verses.text: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas who is called Didymus, and Nathaniel who was from Cana of Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples.

sinaiticus.text: Simon Peter says to them: I go a fishing. They say to him: We also are going with thee. They went out and entered the ship, and on that night they caught nothing.

verses.text: Simon Peter says to them: I go a fishing. They say to him: We also are going with thee. They went out and entered the ship, and on that night they caught nothing.

sinaiticus.text: But the morning having now come, Jesus stood on the shore: the disciples, however, knew not that it was Jesus.

verses.text: But the morning having now come, Jesus stood on the shore: the disciples, however, knew not that it was Jesus.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus therefore says to them: Children, have you any thing to eat? (beside bread). They answered him: No.

verses.text: Jesus therefore says to them: Children, have you any thing to eat? (beside bread). They answered him: No.

sinaiticus.text: He says to them: Cast the net on the right side of the ship, and you shall find. They cast therefore, and were no longer able to draw it because of the multitude of fishes.

verses.text: He says to them: Cast the net on the right side of the ship, and you shall find. They cast therefore, and were no longer able to draw it because of the multitude of fishes.

sinaiticus.text: That disciple whom Jesus loved therefore said to Peter: It is the Lord. Simon Peter therefore, hearing that it was the Lord, girded on his upper garment, for he was naked,* and threw himself into the sea; * Had on only an undergarment

verses.text: That disciple whom Jesus loved therefore said to Peter: It is the Lord. Simon Peter therefore, hearing that it was the Lord, girded on his upper garment, for he was naked,* and threw himself into the sea; * Had on only an undergarment

sinaiticus.text: but the other disciples came with the ship (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits off), dragging the net of fishes.

verses.text: but the other disciples came with the ship (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits off), dragging the net of fishes.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore when they had come to the land, they saw a fire of coals lying, and fish lying on it, and bread.

verses.text: Therefore when they had come to the land, they saw a fire of coals lying, and fish lying on it, and bread.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to them: Bring of the fish that you have just now taken.

verses.text: Jesus says to them: Bring of the fish that you have just now taken.

sinaiticus.text: Simon Peter came up and drew the net to land, full of great fishes, a hundred and fifty-three: and though there were so many, the net was not rent.

verses.text: Simon Peter came up and drew the net to land, full of great fishes, a hundred and fifty-three: and though there were so many, the net was not rent.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to them: Come and breakfast. But no one of the disciples ventured to ask him: Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.

verses.text: Jesus says to them: Come and breakfast. But no one of the disciples ventured to ask him: Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus comes and takes the bread and gives it to them, and the fish in like manner.

verses.text: Jesus comes and takes the bread and gives it to them, and the fish in like manner.

sinaiticus.text: This was now the third time on which Jesus had manifested himself to the disciples, after he had risen from the dead.

verses.text: This was now the third time on which Jesus had manifested himself to the disciples, after he had risen from the dead.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, when they had breakfasted, Jesus says to Simon Peter: Simon, son of Jonah, lovest thou me more than these? He says to him: Yes, Lord, thou knowest that I love thee. He says to him: Feed my lambs.208

verses.text: Therefore, when they had breakfasted, Jesus says to Simon Peter: Simon, son of Jonah, lovest thou me more than these? He says to him: Yes, Lord, thou knowest that I love thee. He says to him: Feed my lambs.208

sinaiticus.text: He says to him again a second time: Simon, son of Jonah, lovest thou me? He says to him: Yes, Lord, thou knowest that I love thee. He says to him: Be a shepherd to my sheep.

verses.text: He says to him again a second time: Simon, son of Jonah, lovest thou me? He says to him: Yes, Lord, thou knowest that I love thee. He says to him: Be a shepherd to my sheep.

sinaiticus.text: He says to him the third time: Simon, son of Jonah, lovest thou me? Peter was grieved because he had said to him the third time: Lovest thou me? And he says to him: Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. He says to him: Feed my sheep.

verses.text: He says to him the third time: Simon, son of Jonah, lovest thou me? Peter was grieved because he had said to him the third time: Lovest thou me? And he says to him: Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. He says to him: Feed my sheep.

sinaiticus.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, when thou wast young thou didst gird thyself and walk whither thou wouldst; but when thou shalt become old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carry thee whither thou wouldst not.

verses.text: Verily, verily, I say to you, when thou wast young thou didst gird thyself and walk whither thou wouldst; but when thou shalt become old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carry thee whither thou wouldst not.

sinaiticus.text: But this he spoke signifying by what kind of death he should glorify God. And having said this, he says to him: Follow me.

verses.text: But this he spoke signifying by what kind of death he should glorify God. And having said this, he says to him: Follow me.

sinaiticus.text: Peter turned and saw the disciple that Jesus loved following, who also reclined at supper on his breast and said: Lord, who is he that delivers thee up?

verses.text: Peter turned and saw the disciple that Jesus loved following, who also reclined at supper on his breast and said: Lord, who is he that delivers thee up?

sinaiticus.text: Peter therefore, seeing this man, says to Jesus: Lord, but what shall this man do?

verses.text: Peter therefore, seeing this man, says to Jesus: Lord, but what shall this man do?

sinaiticus.text: Jesus says to him: If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to thee? Follow thou me.

verses.text: Jesus says to him: If I will that he remain till I come, what is that to thee? Follow thou me.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore went this saying, forth among the brethren, that that disciple should not die; and yet Jesus did not say to him: Thou shalt not die, but: If I will that he remain till I come.

verses.text: Therefore went this saying, forth among the brethren, that that disciple should not die; and yet Jesus did not say to him: Thou shalt not die, but: If I will that he remain till I come.

sinaiticus.text: This is the disciple that testifies of these things, and that wrote The Acts of the Apostles

verses.text: This is the disciple that testifies of these things, and that wrote The Acts of the Apostles
